  9441                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9442                                  
  9443                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9444                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
  9445                                  ; drive.
  9446                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
  9447                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
  9448                                  ; returns in si:
  9449                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
  9450                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
  9451                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
  9452                                  ;
  9453                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
  9454                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9455                                  
  9456                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9457                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
  9458 00000553 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
  9459 00000556 E821FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
  9460 00000559 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
  9461                                  					; get stored time
  9462 0000055D 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
  9463 0000055F 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
  9464 00000563 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
  9465 00000565 751A                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
  9466 00000567 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
  9467 00000569 7511                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
  9468 0000056B FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
  9469 0000056F 803E[1D01]05            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
  9470                                  					; if count is less than threshold, ok
  9471 00000574 720C                    		jb	short timecheck_ret
  9472 00000576 FE0E[1D01]              		dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
  9473 0000057A EB05                    		jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
  9474                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9475                                  
  9476                                  timepassed:				
  9477 0000057C 83FA24                  		cmp	dx, 36		; 18*2 ; 18.2 tics per second.
  9478                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
  9479 0000057F 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
  9480                                  
  9481                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.
  9482                                  timecheck_unk:				
  9483 00000581 4E                      		dec	si		; presume i don't know
  9484                                  timecheck_ret:				
  9485 00000582 C3                      		retn
  9486                                  
  9487                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

  9616                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9617                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
  9618                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
  9619                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
  9620                                  ;	    for all other cases,
  9621                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
  9622                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
  9623                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
  9624                                  ;
  9625                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
  9626                                  ;
  9627                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
  9628                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
  9629                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
  9630                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
  9631                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
  9632                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
  9633                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
  9634                                  ;
  9635                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
  9636                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
  9637                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
  9638                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9639                                  
  9640                                  GetBp:		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.
  9641                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], return_fake_bpb|fnon_removable		
  9642 000005F7 26F6452305              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 5

  9644 000005FE E99500                  		jmp	getret_exit

  9654                                  		; have a valid boot sector.

  9751 00000687 26894D19                		mov	[es:di+19h], cx ; 0 ; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  9752 0000068B 26894D17                		mov	[es:di+17h], cx ; 0 ; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  9753 0000068F 26894D1D                		mov	[es:di+1Dh], cx ; 0 ; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  9754                                  getret:					
  9755 00000693 5B                      		pop	bx
  9756 00000694 5A                      		pop	dx
  9757 00000695 59                      		pop	cx
  9758                                  getret_exit:				
  9759 00000696 C3                      		retn
  9760                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9761                                  
  9762                                  getbp_err_ret:	; before doing anything else, set set_id_flag	to 0.			
  9763                                  		;mov	ds:set_id_flag,	0
  9764                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9765 00000697 C606[0A05]00            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 0
  9766 0000069C E83105                  		call	maperror
  9767 0000069F EBF2                    		jmp	short getret
  9768                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9769                                  
  9770                                  		; we have a 3.5" diskette for	which we cannot	build a	bpb.
  9771                                  		; we do	not assume any type of bpb for this medium.
  9772                                  
  9773                                  got_unknown_medium:			
  9774                                  		;mov	ds:set_id_flag,	0 
  9775 000006A1 C606[0A05]00            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 0
  9776 000006A6 B007                    		mov	al, 7
  9777 000006A8 F9                      		stc
  9778 000006A9 EBE8                    		jmp	short getret
  9779                                  
  9780                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9781                                  
  9782                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9783                                  
  9784                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9785                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
  9786                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
  9787                                  ;
  9788                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
  9789                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9790                                  
  9791                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9792                                  
  9793                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
  9794                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, BIOSCODE:06C3h)
  9795                                  
  9796                                  readbootsec:	
  9797 000006AB B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
  9798 000006AD B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
  9799 000006B0 E8C600                  		call	read_sector
  9800 000006B3 724A                    		jb	short err_ret
  9801 000006B5 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
  9802                                  
  9803                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
  9804                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
  9805                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
  9806                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
  9807                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
  9808                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
  9809                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
  9810                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
  9811                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
  9812                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
  9813                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
  9814                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
  9815                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
  9816                                  		; informations
  9817                                  
  9818                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
  9819                                  
  9820                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9821 000006B7 803E[4E01]69            		cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
  9822 000006BC 7415                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
  9823 000006BE 803E[4E01]E9            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
  9824 000006C3 740E                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
  9825 000006C5 803E[4E01]EB            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
  9826 000006CA 7531                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9827 000006CC 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
  9828 000006D1 752A                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9829                                  
  9830                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9831                                  ;
  9832                                  ;; 10/03/2019
  9833                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
  9834                                  ;;
  9835                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
  9836                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
  9837                                  ;;
  9838                                  ;;check_signature:
  9839                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
  9840                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
  9841                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
  9842                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
  9843                                  
  9844                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
  9845                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
  9846                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
  9847                                  
  9848                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9849                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:			
  9850 000006D3 A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
  9851                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  9852 000006D6 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
  9853 000006D8 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
  9854 000006DA 7521                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9855                                  
  9856                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
  9857                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
  9858                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
  9859                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
  9860                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
  9861                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
  9862                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
  9863                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
  9864                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
  9865                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
  9866                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
  9867                                  
  9868                                  checksinglesided:
  9869 000006DC A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
  9870 000006DF 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
  9871 000006E1 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
  9872 000006E3 A801                    		test	al, 1
  9873 000006E5 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
  9874 000006E7 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
  9875 000006ED 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
  9876 000006EF 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
  9877 000006F4 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
  9878                                  
  9879                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
  9880                                  
  9881                                  mustbeearlier:				
  9882 000006F6 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
  9883                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  9884 000006FB EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
  9885                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9886                                  
  9887                                  invalidbootsec:				
  9888 000006FD 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
  9889                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9890                                  movbpb_ret:
  9891                                  gooddsk:				
  9892 000006FE F8                      		clc
  9893                                  err_ret:
  9894 000006FF C3                      		retn
  9895                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9896                                  
  9897                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9898                                  ;err_ret:				
  9899                                  		;retn
  9900                                  
  9901                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9902                                  
  9903                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9904                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9905                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
  9906                                  ; getbp routine at has1
  9907                                  ;
  9908                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
  9909                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
  9910                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
  9911                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
  9912                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
  9913                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
  9914                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9915                                  
  9916                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9917                                  
  9918                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9919                                  movbpb:	
  9920 00000700 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
  9921                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  9922                                  					; sectors per unit
  9923 00000704 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
  9924                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
  9925                                  					; number of directory entries
  9926 00000708 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
  9927                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
  9928                                  					; size of drive
  9929 0000070C 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
  9930                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  9931                                  					; media	descriptor
  9932 00000710 A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
  9933                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
  9934                                  					; number of fat	sectors
  9935 00000713 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
  9936                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
  9937                                  					; sectors per track
  9938 00000717 8A16[6801]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
  9939                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
  9940                                  					; number of heads
  9941 0000071B 803E[0A05]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
  9942 00000720 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
  9943 00000722 E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
  9944 00000725 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
  9945 00000727 C606[0A05]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
  9946                                  movbpb_conv:				
  9947 0000072C 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
  9948 00000731 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
  9949 00000733 E8D411                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
  9950                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9951                                  		; cf = 0
  9952                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
  9953                                  		;clc
  9954 00000736 C3                      		retn
  9955                                  
  9956                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9957                                  
  9958                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
  9959                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
  9960                                  ;by es:di.
  9961                                  
  9962                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
  9963                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
  9964                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
  9965                                  ;      the boot record information.
  9966                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
  9967                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
  9968                                  
  9969                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9970                                  mov_media_ids:		
  9971 00000737 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
  9972                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
  9973                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
  9974 0000073C 752C                    		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
  9975 0000073E 51                      		push	cx
  9976 0000073F 8B0E[7501]              		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
  9977                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
  9978 00000743 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
  9979 00000747 8B0E[7701]              		mov	cx, [disksector+29h]
  9980                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
  9981 0000074B 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
  9982 0000074F 57                      		push	di
  9983 00000750 56                      		push	si
  9984 00000751 B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
  9985 00000754 BE[7901]                		mov	si, disksector+2Bh
  9986                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+2Bh) ;
  9987                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.VOL_LABEL
  9988 00000757 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
  9989 0000075A F3A4                    		rep movsb
  9990                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
  9991                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9992 0000075C B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8
  9993 0000075E BE[8401]                		mov	si, disksector+36h
  9994                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+36h) ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SYSTEM_ID
  9995 00000761 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
  9996 00000764 F3A4                    		rep movsb
  9997 00000766 5E                      		pop	si
  9998 00000767 5F                      		pop	di
  9999 00000768 59                      		pop	cx
 10000                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10001                                  		; cf = 0
 10002                                  		;clc		; this clc is not required (16/06/2019 - Erdogan Tan)
 10003                                  				; (20/09/2022)
 10004 00000769 C3                      		retn
 10005                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10006                                  
 10007                                  mmi_not_ext:				
 10008 0000076A F9                      		stc
 10009 0000076B C3                      		retn
 10010                                  
 10011                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10012                                  
 10013                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10014                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10015                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 10016                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 10017                                  ; output:
 10018                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
 10019                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit
 10020                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10021                                  
 10022                                  readfat:	
 10023                                  		;mov	dh, 0
 10024                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10025 0000076C 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
 10026 0000076E B90200                  		mov	cx, 2		; head 0
 10027                                  					; cylinder 0, sector 2
 10028 00000771 E80500                  		call	read_sector
 10029 00000774 7202                    		jb	short bad_fat_ret
 10030 00000776 8A27                    		mov	ah, [bx]	; media	byte
 10031                                  bad_fat_ret:				
 10032 00000778 C3                      		retn
 10033                                  
 10034                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10035                                  
 10036                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10037                                  
 10038                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10039                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 10040                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 10041                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 10042                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 10043                                  ;		dh has head
 10044                                  ;		es:di has bds
 10045                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 10046                                  ;
 10047                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 10048                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 10049                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 10050                                  ;
 10051                                  ;		carry set
 10052                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 10053                                  ;
 10054                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 10055                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10056                                  
 10057                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10058                                  
 10059                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10060                                  read_sector:	
 10061 00000779 55                      		push	bp
 10062 0000077A BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 10063 0000077D 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10064 00000781 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 10065                                  rd_ret:					
 10066 00000784 06                      		push	es
 10067 00000785 1E                      		push	ds
 10068 00000786 07                      		pop	es
 10069 00000787 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10070 0000078A CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10071                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10072                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10073                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10074 0000078C 07                      		pop	es
 10075 0000078D 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 10076                                  rd_rty:					
 10077 0000078F E87604                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 10078 00000792 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret
 10079 00000794 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10080                                  		;test	byte ptr [es:di+23h], 1	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10081                                  					; fnon_removable
 10082 00000799 75E9                    		jnz	short rd_ret
 10083 0000079B 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10084 000007A0 7510                    		jnz	short rd_skip1_dpt
 10085 000007A2 50                      		push	ax
 10086 000007A3 1E                      		push	ds		; for retry, set the head settle time to 0Fh
 10087 000007A4 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10088                                  		;mov	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10089                                  		;mov	byte [si+9], 15 ; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10090                                  		;			; NORMSETTLE
 10091                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10092 000007A8 B00F                    		mov	al, 15
 10093 000007AA 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]
 10094                                  		; 
 10095 000007AD 1F                      		pop	ds
 10096 000007AE A2[2A01]                		mov	[save_head_sttl], al
 10097 000007B1 58                      		pop	ax
 10098                                  rd_skip1_dpt:				
 10099 000007B2 06                      		push	es
 10100 000007B3 1E                      		push	ds
 10101 000007B4 07                      		pop	es
 10102 000007B5 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10103 000007B8 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10104                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10105                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10106                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10107 000007BA 07                      		pop	es
 10108 000007BB 9C                      		pushf
 10109 000007BC 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10110 000007C1 750E                    		jnz	short rd_skip2_dpt
 10111 000007C3 50                      		push	ax
 10112 000007C4 A0[2A01]                		mov	al, [save_head_sttl]
 10113 000007C7 1E                      		push	ds
 10114 000007C8 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10115 000007CC 884409                  		mov	[si+9],	al	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10116 000007CF 1F                      		pop	ds
 10117 000007D0 58                      		pop	ax
 10118                                  rd_skip2_dpt:				
 10119 000007D1 9D                      		popf
 10120 000007D2 7305                    		jnb	short okret2
 10121 000007D4 EBB9                    		jmp	short rd_rty
 10122                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10123                                  
 10124                                  err_rd_ret:				
 10125 000007D6 B2FF                    		mov	dl, 0FFh	; make sure we ask rom if media	has changed
 10126                                  					; return error
 10127 000007D8 F9                      		stc
 10128                                  
 10129                                  ; update information pertaining to last drive accessed, time of access, last
 10130                                  ; track accessed in that drive.
 10131                                  
 10132                                  okret2:					
 10133 000007D9 8816[7600]              		mov	[step_drv], dl	; set up for head settle logic in disk
 10134 000007DD 8816[1E01]              		mov	[tim_drv], dl	; save drive last accessed
 10135 000007E1 26886D46                		mov	[es:di+46h], ch	; [es:di+BDS.track]
 10136                                  					; save last track accessed on this drive
 10137                                  					; preserve flags in case error occurred
 10138 000007E5 9C                      		pushf
 10139 000007E6 E8FF03                  		call	set_tim
 10140 000007E9 9D                      		popf			; restore flags
 10141 000007EA 5D                      		pop	bp
 10142 000007EB C3                      		retn
 10143                                  
 10144                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10145                                  ;	disk open/close routines
 10146                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10147                                  
 10148                                  dsk_open:				; 2C7h:80Ah = 70h:2D7Ah
 10149 000007EC 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0

 10151 000007F3 E8D5FC                  		call	SetDrive	; get bds for drive

 10153                                  dsk_open_exit:

 10155                                  		; cf = 0			
 10156                                  		;clc		; CF is	already	ZERO here (18/09/2022, MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)

 10161                                  dsk_close:				; 2C7h:81Ah = 70h:2D8Ah
 10162 000007FB 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 10163 00000800 740E                    		jz	short exitjx	; done if no changeline	support

 10165 00000805 26837D2000              		cmp	word [es:di+20h], 0 ; [es:di+BDS.opcnt]

 10237                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10238                                  ; miscellaneous odd jump routines. 
 10239                                  ; moved out of mainline for speed.
 10240                                  
 10241                                  ; if we have a system where we have virtual drives, we need 
 10242                                  ; to prompt the user to place the correct disk in the drive.
 10243                                  ;
 10244                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds:->Bios_Data

 10248                                  checksingle:		
 10249 0000083B 50                      		push	ax
 10250 0000083C 53                      		push	bx
 10251 0000083D 268B5D23                		mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10252                                  
 10253                                  ; if hard drive, cannot change disk.
 10254                                  ; if current owner of physical drive, no need to change diskette.
 10255                                  
 10256 00000841 F6C321                  		test	bl, 21h		; fnon_removable|fi_own_physical
 10257 00000844 7573                    		jnz	short singleret

 10259                                  					; is there a drive sharing this	physical drive?
 10260 00000849 746E                    		jz	short singleret
 10261                                  
 10262                                  
 10263                                  ; look for the previous owner of this physical drive
 10264                                  ; and reset its ownership flag.
 10265                                  
 10266 0000084B 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10267                                  					; get physical drive number

 10269 00000850 57                      		push	di
 10270 00000851 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds
 10271                                  scan_list:				
 10272 00000855 26384504                		cmp	[es:di+4], al
 10273 00000859 7553                    		jnz	short scan_skip	; Not our drive. Try next bds.
 10274 0000085B B320                    		mov	bl, 20h	; ' '   ; fi_own_physical ; test ownership flag
 10275 0000085D 26845D23                		test	[es:di+23h], bl
 10276 00000861 744B                    		jz	short scan_skip	; he doesn't own it either. continue
 10277 00000863 26305D23                		xor	[es:di+23h], bl	; reset	ownership flag
 10278 00000867 5F                      		pop	di		; restore pointer to current bds
 10279 00000868 07                      		pop	es
 10280 00000869 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; ; set	ownership flag
 10281                                  
 10282                                  ; we examine the fsetowner flag. if it is set, then we are using the code in
 10283                                  ; checksingle to just set the owner of a drive. we must not issue the prompt
 10284                                  ; in this case.

 10286 00000872 7517                    		jnz	short not_fsetowner

 10288 00000874 26807D0400              		cmp	byte [es:di+4], 0
 10289 00000879 753E                    		jnz	short singleret
 10290 0000087B 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]
 10291                                  		;mov	al, es:[di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 10292                                  					; get the DOS drive letter
 10293 0000087F 06                      		push	es
 10294 00000880 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10295 00000884 26A20405                		mov	[es:LSTDRV], al
 10296                                  		;mov	es:504h, al	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10297                                  					; set up sdsb

 10299 00000889 EB2E                    		jmp	short singleret
 10300                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10301                                  
 10302                                  ; to support "backward" compatibility with ibm's "single drive status byte"
 10303                                  ; we now check to see if we are in a single drive system and the application
 10304                                  ; has "cleverly" diddled the sdsb
 10305                                  
 10306                                  not_fsetowner:

 10309 00000892 50                      		push	ax
 10310 00000893 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; if (curr_drv == req_drv)
 10311 00000897 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 10312 00000899 06                      		push	es
 10313 0000089A 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10314 0000089E 2686060405              		xchg	al, [es:LSTDRV]

 10316                                  					; then swap(curr_drv,req_drv)

 10319 000008A6 58                      		pop	ax		; swap(curr_drv,req_drv)

 10321                                  ignore_sdsb:

 10325                                  
 10326                                  scan_skip:

 10329                                  					; go to	next bds

 10359                                  ; 15/10/52022
 10360                                  
 10361                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10362                                  ;	disk i/o handler
 10363                                  ;
 10364                                  ;	al = drive number (0-6)
 10365                                  ;	ah = media descriptor
 10366                                  ;	cx = sector count
 10367                                  ;	dx = first sector (low)
 10368                                  ;	[start_sec_h] = first sector (high)  32 bit calculation.
 10369                                  ;	ds = cs
 10370                                  ;	es:di = transfer address
 10371                                  ;	[rflag]=operation (2=read, 3=write)
 10372                                  ;	[verify]=1 for verify after write
 10373                                  ;
 10374                                  ;	if successful carry flag = 0
 10375                                  ;	  else cf=1 and al contains error code
 10376                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10377                                  
 10378                                  diskrd:	
 10379                                  		;mov	ds:rflag, 2	; romread
 10380                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10381 000008C4 C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2 ; romread
 10382                                  
 10383                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10384                                  
 10385                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10386                                  diskio:
 10387 000008C9 89FB                    		mov	bx, di		; es:bx	= transfer address
 10388 000008CB 8C06[3705]              		mov	[xfer_seg], es	; save transfer	segment
 10389 000008CF E8F9FB                  		call	SetDrive
 10390 000008D2 268A4510                		mov	al, [es:di+10h]	; [es:di+BDS.media]
 10391 000008D6 A2[1F01]                		mov	[medbyt], al
 10392                                  		;jcxz	short ioret
 10393 000008D9 E3E8                    		jcxz	ioret
 10394                                  
 10395                                  ; see if the media is formatted or not by checking the flags field in
 10396                                  ; in the bds. if it is unformatted we cannot allow i/o, so we should
 10397                                  ; go to the error exit at label unformatteddrive.
 10398                                  
 10399 000008DB 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 2
 10400                                  		;test	byte ptr es:[di+24h], 2	; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
 10401                                  					; unformatted_media
 10402 000008E0 75DE                    		jnz	short unformatteddrive
 10403 000008E2 890E[2201]              		mov	[seccnt], cx	; save sector count
 10404 000008E6 8926[3501]              		mov	[spsav], sp	; save sp
 10405                                  
 10406                                  ; ensure that we are trying to access valid sectors on the drive
 10407                                  
 10408 000008EA 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 10409 000008EC 31F6                    		xor	si, si
 10410 000008EE 01CA                    		add	dx, cx
 10411 000008F0 83D600                  		adc	si, 0
 10412 000008F3 26837D0E00              		cmp	word [es:di+0Eh], 0 ; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 10413                                  					; > 32 bit sector ?
 10414 000008F8 740D                    		jz	short sanity32
 10415 000008FA 83FE00                  		cmp	si, 0
 10416 000008FD 75BD                    		jnz	short baddrive
 10417 000008FF 263B550E                		cmp	dx, [es:di+0Eh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 10418 00000903 77B7                    		ja	short baddrive
 10419 00000905 EB12                    		jmp	short sanityok
 10420                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10421                                  
 10422                                  sanity32:				
 10423 00000907 0336[2B05]              		add	si, [start_sec_h]
 10424 0000090B 263B751D                		cmp	si, [es:di+1Dh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
 10425 0000090F 7208                    		jb	short sanityok
 10426 00000911 77A9                    		ja	short baddrive
 10427 00000913 263B551B                		cmp	dx, [es:di+1Bh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32]
 10428 00000917 77A3                    		ja	short baddrive
 10429                                  
 10430                                  sanityok:				
 10431 00000919 8B16[2B05]              		mov	dx, [start_sec_h]
 10432 0000091D 26034517                		add	ax, [es:di+17h]	; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs]
 10433 00000921 26135519                		adc	dx, [es:di+19h]	; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
 10434                                  
 10435                                  ; now dx;ax have the physical first sector.
 10436                                  ; since the following procedures is going to destroy ax, let's
 10437                                  ; save it temporarily to saved_word.
 10438                                  
 10439 00000925 A3[2D05]                		mov	[saved_word], ax ; save the sector number (low)
 10440                                  
 10441                                  ; set up pointer to disk base table in [dpt]. we cannot assume that iosetup
 10442                                  ; will do it because we will skip the set up stuff with hard disks.
 10443                                  
 10444 00000928 06                      		push	es
 10445 00000929 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10446 0000092D 26C4367800              		les	si, [es:DSKADR]
 10447                                  		;les	si, es:78h	; [es:DSKADR]
 10448                                  					; current disk parm table
 10449 00000932 8936[2D01]              		mov	[dpt], si
 10450 00000936 8C06[2F01]              		mov	[dpt+2], es
 10451 0000093A 07                      		pop	es
 10452 0000093B 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10453                                  					; fnon_removable
 10454 00000940 7510                    		jnz	short skip_setup
 10455 00000942 E8F6FE                  		call	checksingle
 10456                                  
 10457                                  ; check to see if we have previously noted a change line. the routine
 10458                                  ; returns if everything is ok. otherwise, it pops off the stack and returns
 10459                                  ; the proper error code.
 10460                                  
 10461 00000945 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0 ; do we have changeline support?
 10462 0000094A 7403                    		jz	short diskio_nochangeline ; brif not
 10463 0000094C E8AB0E                  		call	checklatchio	; will do a sneaky pop stack return
 10464                                  					; if a disk error occurs
 10465                                  diskio_nochangeline:			
 10466 0000094F E84700                  		call	iosetup		; set up tables	and variables for i/o
 10467                                  
 10468                                  ; now the settle values are correct for the following code
 10469                                  
 10470                                  skip_setup:
 10471                                  
 10472                                  ; 32 bit sector calculation.
 10473                                  ; dx:[saved_word] = starting sector number.
 10474                                  				
 10475 00000952 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 10476 00000954 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 10477 00000956 26F77513                		div	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 10478                                  					 ; divide by sec per track
 10479 0000095A A3[2905]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
 10480 0000095D A1[2D05]                		mov	ax, [saved_word]
 10481 00000960 26F77513                		div	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 10482                                  					; now, [temp_h]:ax = track #, dx = sector
 10483                                  		;inc	dl		; sector number	is 1 based.
 10484                                  		; 18/12/2022
 10485 00000964 42                      		inc	dx
 10486 00000965 8816[3101]              		mov	[cursec], dl	; save current sector
 10487 00000969 268B4D15                		mov	cx, [es:di+15h]	; es:di+BDS.heads]
 10488                                  					; get number of	heads
 10489 0000096D 50                      		push	ax
 10490 0000096E 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 10491 00000970 A1[2905]                		mov	ax, [temp_h]	; divide tracks	by heads per cylinder
 10492 00000973 F7F1                    		div	cx
 10493 00000975 A3[2905]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
 10494 00000978 58                      		pop	ax

 10496 0000097B 833E[2905]00            		cmp	word [temp_h], 0
 10497 00000980 7714                    		ja	short baddrive_brdg

 10499 00000985 770F                    		ja	short baddrive_brdg

 10502                                  
 10503                                  ; we are now set up for the i/o. normally, we consider the dma boundary
 10504                                  ; violations here. not true. we perform the operation as if everything is
 10505                                  ; symmetric; let the int 13 handler worry about the dma violations.

 10508 00000991 E88400                  		call	block		; (cas - call/ret)

 10510                                  		;retn

 10515

 10520                                  
 10521                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 10522                                  ; set the drive-last-accessed flag for diskette only. 
 10523                                  ; we know that the hard disk will not be removed.
 10524                                  ; es:di -> current bds.
 10525                                  ; ds -> Bios_Data
 10526                                  ; ax,cx,si are destroyed.
 10527                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 10528                                  
 10529                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10530                                  iosetup:	
 10531 00000999 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10532 0000099D A2[1E01]                		mov	[tim_drv], al	; save drive letter
 10533                                  
 10534                                  ; determine proper head settle values
 10535                                  
 10536 000009A0 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10537 000009A5 7539                    		jnz	short skip_dpt_setting

 10539 000009AA 1E                      		push	ds
 10540 000009AB C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]	; get pointer to disk base table
 10541 000009AF 884404                  		mov	[si+4],	al
 10542 000009B2 8A440A                  		mov	al, [si+10]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_MOTOR_STRT]

 10546 000009BC 8826[2B01]              		mov	[save_eot], ah
 10547                                  
 10548                                  ; for 3.5" drives, both external as well as on the k09, we need to set the
 10549                                  ; motor start time to 4. this checking for every i/o is going to affect
 10550                                  ; performance across the board, but is necessary!!
 10551                                  
 10552 000009C0 1E                      		push	ds
 10553 000009C1 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]	; get pointer to disk base table

 10555                                  					; ffSmall

 10559                                  motor_start_ok:
 10560                                  
 10561                                  ; ds:si now points to disk parameter table.
 10562                                  ; get current settle and set fast settle
 10563

 10570                                  					; get settle and set up	for fast

 10572 000009D8 A2[2701]                		mov	[settlecurrent], al

 10574                                  					; someone has diddled the settle
 10575 000009DD A2[2801]                		mov	[settleslow], al
 10576                                  skip_dpt_setting:

 10580                                  
 10581                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 10582                                  ; set time of last access, and reset default values in the dpt.
 10583                                  ;

 10588                                  done:
