 13093                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13094                                  
 13095                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13096                                  
 13097                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13098                                  ;
 13099                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13100                                  ;
 13101                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13102                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13103                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13104                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13105                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13106                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13107                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13108                                  ;
 13109                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13110                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13111                                  ;
 13112                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13113                                  
 13114                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13115                                  HMAPtr:
 13116 000013C3 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13117                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13118 000013C8 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13119                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13120 000013CC 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13121 000013CF 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13122 000013D1 803E[FB08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13123                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13124 000013D6 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13125 000013D8 FF1E[F708]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13126                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13127 000013DC 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13128                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13129                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13130 000013E0 C3                      		retn
 13131                                  
 13132                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13133                                  
 13134                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13135                                  
 13136                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13137                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13138                                  
 13139                                  move_sector:
 13140                                  
 13141                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13142                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13143                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13144                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13145                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13146                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13147                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13148                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13149                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13150                                  ;
 13151                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13152                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13153                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13154                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13155                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13156                                  
 13157 000013E1 FC                      		cld
 13158 000013E2 51                      		push	cx
 13159 000013E3 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13160 000013E6 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13161 000013EA 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13162 000013EC 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13163 000013F0 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13164 000013F2 F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13165 000013F4 59                      		pop	cx
 13166 000013F5 C3                      		retn
 13167                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13168                                  
 13169                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13170 000013F6 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13171 000013F8 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13172 000013FA 59                      		pop	cx
 13173 000013FB C3                      		retn
 13174                                  
 13175                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13176                                  
 13177                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13178                                  
 13179                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13180                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13181                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13182                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13183                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13184                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13185                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13186                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13187                                  ;
 13188                                  ; input conditions:
 13189                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13190                                  ;
 13191                                  ; output:
 13192                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13193                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13194                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13195                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13196                                  
 13197                                  check_wrap:	
 13198 000013FC 50                      		push	ax
 13199 000013FD 53                      		push	bx
 13200 000013FE 06                      		push	es
 13201 000013FF 57                      		push	di
 13202 00001400 E86E00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13203 00001403 7260                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13204                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13205 00001405 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13206                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13207 0000140A 7459                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13208 0000140C 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13209 00001410 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13210 00001412 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13211 00001415 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13212 00001417 764C                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13213 00001419 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13214                                  
 13215                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13216                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13217                                  
 13218 0000141B 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13219 0000141D 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13220                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13221 0000141F 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13222 00001420 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13223                                  					; if on	boundary
 13224                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13225                                  not_on_bound:				
 13226 00001422 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13227 00001425 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13228 00001427 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13229 00001429 40                      		inc	ax
 13230 0000142A 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13231 0000142C 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13232 0000142F 263B4515                		cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13233                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13234 00001433 7636                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13235 00001435 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13236 00001436 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13237 00001438 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13238 0000143C F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13239                                  
 13240                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13241                                  
 13242 0000143E 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13243 00001440 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13244 00001442 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13245                                  
 13246                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13247                                  
 13248 00001444 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13249 00001446 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13250 00001448 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13251                                  no_head_bound:				
 13252 00001449 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13253 0000144B 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13254 0000144C FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13255 0000144E 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13256 00001450 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13257 00001452 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13258 00001455 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13259 00001457 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13260 00001459 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13261 0000145B 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13262 0000145D 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13263 0000145F D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13264 00001461 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13265 00001463 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13266                                  no_wrap:				
 13267 00001465 F8                      		clc
 13268 00001466 5F                      		pop	di
 13269 00001467 07                      		pop	es
 13270 00001468 5B                      		pop	bx
 13271 00001469 58                      		pop	ax
 13272 0000146A C3                      		retn
 13273                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13274                                  
 13275                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13276 0000146B 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13277 0000146D FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13278 0000146F EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13279                                  
 13280                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13281                                  
 13282                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13283                                  
 13284                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13285                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13286                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13287                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13288                                  ;
 13289                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13290                                  
 13291                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13292                                  find_bds:	
 13293 00001471 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13294                                  fbds_1:					
 13295 00001475 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13296 00001479 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13297 0000147B 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13298                                  					; go to next bds
 13299 0000147E 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13300 00001481 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13301 00001483 F9                      		stc
 13302                                  fdbs_2:					
 13303 00001484 C3                      		retn
 13304                                  
 13305                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13306                                  
 13307                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13308                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13309                                  doint:
 13310                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13311 00001485 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13312                                  					; get physical drive number
 13313                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13314                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13315                                  		
 13316 00001488 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13317 0000148A 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13318 0000148C 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13319                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13320 0000148E 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13321                                  					; get request code
 13322                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13323 00001491 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13324                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13325 00001494 9D                      		popf
 13326                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13327                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13328 00001495 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13329                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13330                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13331 0000149A 9C                      		pushf
 13332                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13333 0000149B 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13334                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13335                                  dointdone:				
 13336 0000149E C3                      		retn
 13337                                  
 13338                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13339                                  
 13340                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13341                                  
 13342                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13343                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13344                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13345                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13346                                  ;
 13347                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13348                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13349                                  ;
 13350                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13351                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13352                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13353                                  
 13354                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13355                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13356                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13357                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13358                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13359                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13360                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13361                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13362                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13363                                  ;end struc
 13364                                  
 13365                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13366                                  
 13367                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13368                                  ;	ah = function
 13369                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13370                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13371                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13372                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13373                                  ;   output conditions:
 13374                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13375                                  
 13376                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13377                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13378                                  ;
 13379                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13380                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13381                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13382                                  
 13383                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13384                                  
 13385                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13386                                  
 13387 0000149F 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13388                                  
 13389                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13390                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13391                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13392                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13393                                  
 13394                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13395                                  
 13396                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13397                                  
 13398                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13399                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13400                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 13401                                  
 13402                                  format_special_stuff:			
 13403 000014A3 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 13404 000014A8 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 13405 000014AA 53                      		push	bx
 13406 000014AB BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 13407 000014AE E83804                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13408 000014B1 5B                      		pop	bx
 13409 000014B2 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 13410                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13411                                  
 13412                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13413                                  
 13414                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13415                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13416                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 13417                                  
 13418                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13419                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 13420 000014B4 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 13421 000014B6 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 13422 000014B8 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 13423 000014B9 51                      		push	cx
 13424 000014BA 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 13425 000014BC B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 13426 000014BE D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 13427 000014C0 8406[3105]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 13428 000014C4 59                      		pop	cx
 13429 000014C5 58                      		pop	ax
 13430 000014C6 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13431                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 13432 000014C8 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 13433 000014C9 06                      		push	es
 13434                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13435 000014CA 2EC41E[9F14]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 13436                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 13437                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 13438 000014CF 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 13439 000014D1 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 13440 000014D4 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13441                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13442                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13443 000014D8 07                      		pop	es
 13444 000014D9 5B                      		pop	bx
 13445 000014DA EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13446                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13447                                  
 13448                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13449                                  
 13450                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13451                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13452                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13453                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13454                                  
 13455                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13456 000014DC 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13457                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13458 000014E1 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 13459 000014E3 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 13460                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13461 000014E8 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13462                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 13463 000014EA 50                      		push	ax
 13464 000014EB B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 13465                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 13466                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13467 000014ED 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13468                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 13469                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13470 000014F2 58                      		pop	ax
 13471 000014F3 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13472                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13473                                  
 13474                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13475                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13476                                  
 13477                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 13478                                  
 13479                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 13480                                  
 13481                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 13482                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 13483                                  
 13484                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13485 000014F5 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 13486                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 13487                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 13488 000014F6 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13489                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13490                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13491                                  
 13492                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 13493                                  
 13494 000014FB A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 13495 000014FE 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13496 00001501 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 13497                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 13498                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 13499 00001503 803E[3105]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 13500 00001508 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 13501                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 13502                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 13503                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 13504 0000150A 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13505                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13506                                  		
 13507 0000150F 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 13508                                  		
 13509 00001510 803E[3E06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 13510                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 13511 00001515 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 13512                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 13513                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 13514 00001517 9D                      		popf
 13515 00001518 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 13516                                  ret_from_i13:				
 13517 0000151A 1F                      		pop	ds
 13518 0000151B CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 13519                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13520                                  
 13521                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 13522                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 13523                                  ; a changeline error.
 13524                                  
 13525                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 13526 0000151E 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 13527                                  i13_ret_error:				
 13528 00001520 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 13529 00001523 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 13530 00001525 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 13531 00001527 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 13532 00001529 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 13533 0000152E 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 13534                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 13535                                  					; never	would
 13536 00001530 53                      		push	bx
 13537 00001531 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 13538 00001534 E8B203                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13539 00001537 5B                      		pop	bx
 13540                                  int13b:					
 13541 00001538 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 13542 00001539 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 13543                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13544                                  
 13545                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 13546                                  
 13547                                  goterr13:				
 13548 0000153B 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 13549 0000153E 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 13550                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 13551 00001540 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 13552 00001543 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 13553 00001545 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 13554 0000154A 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 13555                                  
 13556 0000154C 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 13557                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 13558                                  					; (2 = romread)
 13559                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 13560 00001551 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 13561                                  
 13562 00001553 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13563                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 13564                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13565 00001555 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13566                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13567                                  					; call far 70:797h
 13568 0000155A A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 13569 0000155D 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 13570 0000155F 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 13571 00001561 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 13572 00001563 53                      		push	bx
 13573 00001564 51                      		push	cx
 13574 00001565 52                      		push	dx
 13575 00001566 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 13576                                  loop_ecc:				
 13577 00001569 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13578                                  
 13579                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 13580                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 13581                                  ;
 13582                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 13583                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 13584                                  ; track.
 13585                                  ;
 13586                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 13587                                  ; this request.
 13588                                  ;
 13589                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 13590                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 13591                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 13592                                  ;
 13593 0000156C E88DFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 13594                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 13595                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13596 0000156F 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13597                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13598 00001574 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 13599 00001576 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 13600 00001579 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 13601 0000157B 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 13602 0000157E 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 13603                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13604                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 13605                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 13606 00001580 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 13607                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 13608                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 13609                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 13610                                  ok11_op:				
 13611 00001582 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 13612 00001586 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 13613 00001588 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 13614                                  					; add 200h to address
 13615 0000158A FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13616 0000158C FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13617 0000158E EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 13618                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13619                                  
 13620                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 13621                                  
 13622                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 13623 00001590 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 13624                                  ok11_exit:				
 13625 00001591 5A                      		pop	dx
 13626 00001592 59                      		pop	cx
 13627 00001593 5B                      		pop	bx
 13628 00001594 EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13629                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13630                                  
 13631                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 13632                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 13633                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 13634                                  
 13635                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 13636 00001596 06                      		push	es
 13637 00001597 53                      		push	bx
 13638 00001598 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13639 0000159B 1E                      		push	ds
 13640 0000159C 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 13641 0000159D B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13642                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 13643                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13644 000015A0 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13645                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13646 000015A5 5B                      		pop	bx
 13647 000015A6 07                      		pop	es
 13648 000015A7 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 13649 000015A9 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 13650 000015AC 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 13651                                  
 13652                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 13653                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 13654                                  
 13655                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 13656 000015AE 56                      		push	si
 13657 000015AF 57                      		push	di
 13658 000015B0 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13659 000015B2 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13660 000015B5 E829FE                  		call	move_sector
 13661 000015B8 5F                      		pop	di
 13662 000015B9 5E                      		pop	si
 13663 000015BA EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 13664                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13665                                  
 13666                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 13667                                  ; operation as best we can.
 13668                                  
 13669                                  gotdmaerr:				
 13670 000015BC A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 13671 000015BF FB                      		sti
 13672 000015C0 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 13673 000015C3 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13674                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 13675                                  					; functions we don't handle
 13676 000015C5 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 13677 000015C8 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 13678 000015CA 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13679 000015CD 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 13680 000015CF 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13681                                  
 13682                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 13683                                  
 13684                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 13685                                  
 13686 000015D1 52                      		push	dx
 13687 000015D2 51                      		push	cx
 13688 000015D3 53                      		push	bx
 13689 000015D4 50                      		push	ax
 13690 000015D5 55                      		push	bp
 13691 000015D6 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 13692 000015D8 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 13693 000015DA D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13694 000015DC D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13695 000015DE D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13696 000015E0 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 13697 000015E2 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 13698 000015E4 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 13699                                  
 13700                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 13701                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 13702                                  
 13703 000015E8 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 13704 000015EA E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 13705                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13706                                  
 13707                                  no_skip_first:				
 13708 000015ED D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 13709 000015EF B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 13710 000015F1 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 13711                                  
 13712                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 13713                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 13714                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 13715                                  ;
 13716                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 13717                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 13718                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 13719                                  ; in error.
 13720                                  
 13721 000015F3 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 13722 000015F5 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 13723                                  
 13724                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 13725                                  
 13726 000015F7 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13727                                  					; set up head number
 13728 000015FA E888FE                  		call	doint
 13729 000015FD E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 13730                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13731                                  
 13732                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 13733 00001600 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 13734 00001602 F9                      		stc
 13735 00001603 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 13736                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 13737                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13738                                  
 13739                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 13740                                  
 13741                                  intverify:				
 13742 00001606 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 13743 00001607 53                      		push	bx
 13744 00001608 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 13745 00001609 07                      		pop	es
 13746                                  dosimple:				
 13747 0000160A BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13748                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 13749                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 13750                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13751 0000160D 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13752                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13753 00001612 5B                      		pop	bx
 13754 00001613 07                      		pop	es
 13755 00001614 E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13756                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13757                                  
 13758                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 13759                                  
 13760                                  intformat:				
 13761 00001617 06                      		push	es
 13762 00001618 53                      		push	bx
 13763 00001619 56                      		push	si
 13764 0000161A 57                      		push	di
 13765 0000161B 1E                      		push	ds
 13766                                  
 13767                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 13768                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 13769                                  
 13770 0000161C 06                      		push	es
 13771 0000161D 1E                      		push	ds
 13772 0000161E 07                      		pop	es
 13773 0000161F 1F                      		pop	ds
 13774 00001620 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 13775 00001622 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 13776 00001625 E8B9FD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 13777 00001628 1F                      		pop	ds
 13778 00001629 5F                      		pop	di
 13779 0000162A 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 13780 0000162B EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 13781                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13782                                  
 13783                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 13784                                  ; the first block.
 13785                                  ;
 13786                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 13787                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 13788                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 13789                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 13790                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 13791                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 13792                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 13793                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 13794                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 13795                                  
 13796                                  doblock:
 13797                                  
 13798                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 13799                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 13800                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 13801                                  				
 13802 0000162D 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13803                                  					; get head #, drive #
 13804 00001630 51                      		push	cx
 13805 00001631 06                      		push	es
 13806 00001632 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13807                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 13808 00001633 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 13809 00001636 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13810                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13811 0000163A 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13812                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13813 0000163F 5F                      		pop	di
 13814 00001640 07                      		pop	es
 13815 00001641 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 13816 00001643 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 13817 00001645 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 13818 00001647 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13819                                  doblockflop:				
 13820 00001649 59                      		pop	cx
 13821                                  doblockcontinue:			
 13822 0000164A 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 13823 0000164C 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 13824 0000164E 50                      		push	ax
 13825 0000164F 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 13826 00001651 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 13827                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13828                                  
 13829                                  doblocklast:				
 13830 00001653 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 13831 00001655 50                      		push	ax
 13832                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 13833 00001656 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 13834 00001659 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 13835 0000165B 58                      		pop	ax
 13836 0000165C 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 13837                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 13838 0000165F 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 13839 00001661 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 13840 00001663 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 13841 00001665 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 13842 00001667 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 13843                                  					; then we are done already.
 13844 00001669 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 13845                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 13846 0000166B E88EFD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 13847 0000166E EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 13848                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13849                                  
 13850                                  bufferx:				
 13851 00001670 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13852                                  					; set up head number
 13853                                  buffer:					
 13854 00001673 53                      		push	bx
 13855 00001674 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13856 00001677 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 13857 0000167A 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 13858                                  					
 13859                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 13860                                  
 13861 0000167C 06                      		push	es
 13862 0000167D 1E                      		push	ds
 13863 0000167E 56                      		push	si
 13864 0000167F 57                      		push	di
 13865 00001680 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 13866 00001681 06                      		push	es
 13867 00001682 1F                      		pop	ds
 13868 00001683 07                      		pop	es
 13869 00001684 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 13870 00001687 57                      		push	di		; save it
 13871 00001688 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 13872 0000168A E854FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 13873 0000168D 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 13874                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 13875 0000168E 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 13876 0000168F 5E                      		pop	si
 13877 00001690 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 13878                                  
 13879                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 13880                                  
 13881 00001691 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13882                                  					; get drive number
 13883 00001693 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 13884 00001696 E863FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 13885                                  					;
 13886                                  					; ah is	function
 13887                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 13888                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 13889                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 13890                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 13891                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 13892 00001699 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 13893 0000169C 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 13894 0000169D 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 13895 0000169F EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 13896                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13897                                  
 13898                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 13899                                  
 13900                                  doread:					
 13901 000016A1 06                      		push	es
 13902 000016A2 53                      		push	bx
 13903 000016A3 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 13904 000016A4 07                      		pop	es
 13905 000016A5 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13906 000016A8 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 13907 000016AA 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13908                                  					; get drive number
 13909 000016AD E84CFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 13910                                  					; ah = function
 13911                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 13912                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 13913                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 13914 000016B0 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 13915 000016B3 5B                      		pop	bx
 13916 000016B4 07                      		pop	es
 13917 000016B5 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 13918 000016B7 56                      		push	si
 13919 000016B8 57                      		push	di
 13920 000016B9 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13921 000016BB BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13922 000016BE E820FD                  		call	move_sector
 13923 000016C1 5F                      		pop	di
 13924 000016C2 5E                      		pop	si
 13925                                  
 13926                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 13927                                  
 13928                                  dotail:					
 13929 000016C3 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 13930 000016C4 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 13931 000016C7 41                      		inc	cx
 13932 000016C8 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 13933 000016CB F8                      		clc
 13934 000016CC FEC8                    		dec	al
 13935 000016CE 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 13936                                  
 13937                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 13938                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 13939                                  
 13940 000016D0 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13941 000016D3 E826FD                  		call	check_wrap
 13942 000016D6 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 13943                                  
 13944                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 13945                                  
 13946                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 13947                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 13948                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 13949                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 13950                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 13951                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 13952                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 13953                                  
 13954                                  bad13:					
 13955 000016D9 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 13956 000016DB 5D                      		pop	bp
 13957 000016DC 5B                      		pop	bx
 13958 000016DD 5B                      		pop	bx
 13959 000016DE 59                      		pop	cx
 13960 000016DF 5A                      		pop	dx
 13961 000016E0 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 13962 000016E2 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 13963                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13964                                  
 13965                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 13966 000016E5 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 13967                                  
 13968                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13969                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13970                                  		;db 	0
 13971                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13972                                  
 13973                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 13974                                  
 13975                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)

 13982                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13983                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 13984 000016E8 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 13985 000016EC BF[8706]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 13986 000016EF 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 13987 000016F0 07                      		pop	es
 13988 000016F1 E9C4EE                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 13989                                  
 13990                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13991                                  
 13992                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13993                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 13994                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 13995                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 13996                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13997                                  
 13998                                  install_bds:		
 13999 000016F4 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14000 000016F5 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14001                                  
 14002                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14003                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14004                                  loop_next_bds:				
 14005 000016F8 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14006                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14007 000016FA 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14008 000016FE 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14009                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14010 00001701 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14011 00001703 B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14012 00001705 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14013                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14014 00001709 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14015 0000170C 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14016                                  					; we don't own it
 14017 00001711 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14018                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14019 00001714 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14020 00001717 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14021                                  next_bds:				
 14022 0000171B 833CFF                  		cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14023                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14024 0000171E 75D8                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14025 00001720 8C4402                  		mov	word [si+2], es ; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14026                                  					; install bds
 14027 00001723 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14028 00001725 26C705FFFF              		mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14029                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14030 0000172A 1F                      		pop	ds
 14031                                  
 14032                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 14033                                  ;
 14034                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 14035                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 14036                                  ;
 14037                                  ;		; 01/06/2019
 14038                                  ;		;mov	al,[es:di+52]
 14039                                  ;		mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 14040                                  ;
 14041                                  ;		cmp	al,[eot]
 14042                                  ;		jbe	short _eot_ok
 14043                                  ;		mov	[eot],al
 14044                                  
 14045 0000172B C3                      		retn
 14046

 14054                                  SNGMSG equ sngmsg

 14059                                  ;  ask to swap the disk in drive a:
 14060                                  ;	es:di -> bds

 14065 0000172C F606[CE08]01            swpdsk:		test	byte [IsWin386], 1			
 14066                                  		;test	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Is win386 present?
 14067 00001731 7405                    		jz	short no_win386	; no, skip SetFocus
 14068                                  		
 14069                                  		; set focus to the correct VM
 14070                                  		;;call	far 70h:8D1h	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:179Ah
 14071                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14072 00001733 9A[CF08]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:V86_Crit_SetFocus
 14073                                  		;call	far ptr	V86_Crit_SetFocus ; call far 70h:8D1h
 14074                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:V86_Crit_SetFocus
 14075                                  no_win386:				
 14076 00001738 51                      		push	cx
 14077 00001739 52                      		push	dx
 14078 0000173A 268A5505                		mov	dl, [es:di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 14079                                  					; get the drive	letter
 14080                                  
 14081                                  ; WARNING : next two instructions assume that if the new disk is for drive B
 14082                                  ;           then existing dsk is drive A & vice versa
 14083                                  
 14084 0000173E 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl
 14085 00001740 80F601                  		xor	dh, 1
 14086 00001743 29C9                    		sub	cx, cx		; nobody has handled swap disk
 14087 00001745 B8004A                  		mov	ax, 4A00h	; multMULT<<8)|multMULTSWPDSK
 14088                                  					; broad	cast code for swap disk
 14089                                  					; Broadcast it
 14090 00001748 CD2F                    		int	2Fh	
 14091 0000174A 41                      		inc	cx		; cx == -1 ?
 14092 0000174B 741E                    		jz	short swpdsk9	; somebody has handled it
 14093                                  
 14094                                  ; using a different drive in a one drive system so request the user change disks
 14095                                  
 14096 0000174D 80C241                  		add	dl, 'A'
 14097                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14098 00001750 2E8816[8A17]            		mov	[cs:DRVLET], dl
 14099                                  		; 16/10/2022
 14100                                  		;;mov	byte [cs:drvlet], dl
 14101                                  		;mov	byte ptr cs:17E4h, dl ; [cs:drvlet]
 14102                                  					; 0070h:3D54h =	2C7h:17E4h
 14103 00001755 BE[6E17]                		mov	si, SNGMSG
 14104                                  		;mov	si, 17C8h	; sngmsg
 14105                                  					; 0070h:3D38h =	2C7h:17C8h
 14106 00001758 53                      		push	bx
 14107 00001759 2E                      		cs
 14108 0000175A AC                      		lodsb			; get the next character of the message
 14109                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si]
 14110                                  wrmsg_loop:				
 14111 0000175B CD29                    		int	29h		; DOS 2+ internal - FAST PUTCHAR
 14112                                  					; AL = character to display
 14113 0000175D 2E                      		cs
 14114 0000175E AC                      		lodsb
 14115                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
 14116                                  					; get the next character of the	message
 14117 0000175F 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14118 00001761 75F8                    		jnz	short wrmsg_loop
 14119 00001763 E8A1EA                  		call	con_flush	; flush out keyboard queue
 14120                                  					; call rom-bios
 14121 00001766 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14122 00001768 CD16                    		int	16h		; KEYBOARD - READ CHAR FROM BUFFER, WAIT IF EMPTY
 14123                                  					; Return: AH = scan code, AL = character
 14124 0000176A 5B                      		pop	bx
 14125                                  swpdsk9:				
 14126 0000176B 5A                      		pop	dx
 14127 0000176C 59                      		pop	cx
 14128 0000176D C3                      		retn
