 18866                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18867                                  ;
 18868                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 18869                                  ;
 18870                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.
 18871                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 18872                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 18873                                  ;
 18874                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow
 18875                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 18876                                  ; 
 18877                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18878                                  
 18879                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18880                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:092Ah)
 18881                                  TryToMovDOSHi:
 18882                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18883                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18884                                  	; ds = cs
 18885 00000971 E81300                  	call	MovDOSHi
 18886 00000974 7210                    	jc	short ttldhx
 18887                                  
 18888                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 18889                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18890                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION] ; give dos its temporary loc.
 18891                                  	;;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION] ; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18892                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18893                                  	; ds = cs
 18894 00000976 8E06[7102]              	mov	es,[CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION]
 18895                                  ;else
 18896                                  ;	..
 18897                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 18898                                  
 18899                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18900                                  	; ds = cs
 18901 0000097A 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; ax = 00 ---> install stub
 18902                                  	;call	far [cs:dos_segreinit]	; call dos segreinit
 18903 0000097C FF1E[7B02]              	call	far [dos_segreinit]
 18904                                  	;mov	byte [cs:runhigh],1
 18905 00000980 C606[6A02]01            	mov	byte [runhigh],1
 18906 00000985 F8                      	clc
 18907                                  ttldhx:
 18908 00000986 C3                      	retn
 18909                                  
 18910                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18911                                  ;
 18912                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 18913                                  ;
 18914                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 18915                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 18916                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 18917                                  ;
 18918                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed
 18919                                  ;
 18920                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18921                                  
 18922                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18923                                  MovDOSHi:
 18924                                  	; 14/05/2019
 18925                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18926                                  	; ds = cs
 18927 00000987 E8D900                  	call	AllocHMA
 18928 0000098A 7213                    	jc	short mdhx			; did we get HMA?
 18929 0000098C B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh			; yes, HMA seg = 0ffffh
 18930 0000098F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18931                                  
 18932                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 18933                                  	; actually move the BIOS and DOS
 18934                                  
 18935                                  	; NOTE: Retro DOS v4.0 does not move BIOS (IO.SYS) to HMA
 18936                                  	; 24/03/2019
 18937                                  	
 18938                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18939 00000991 E83400                  	call	MovBIOS				; First move BIOS into HMA
 18940                                  
 18941                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after BIOS
 18942                                  	
 18943                                  	; 14/05/2019
 18944                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18945                                  	;xor	di,di
 18946                                  	
 18947                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18948                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:hi_doscod_size]		; pass the code size of DOS
 18949                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18950                                  	; ds = cs
 18951 00000994 8B0E[8102]              	mov	cx,[hi_doscod_size]		; when it is in HMA
 18952 00000998 E81100                  	call	MovDOS				; and move it
 18953                                  
 18954                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after DOS
 18955                                  ;else
 18956                                  ;	; allocate space at beginning of HMA to allow for CPMHack
 18957                                  ;
 18958                                  ;	mov	di,0E0h				; room for 5 bytes at ffff:d0
 18959                                  ;
 18960                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 18961                                  
 18962 0000099B E86302                  	call	SaveFreeHMAPtr			; Save the Free HMA ptr
 18963 0000099E F8                      	clc
 18964                                  mdhx:
 18965 0000099F C3                      	retn

 19226                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19227                                  ;
 19228                                  ; procedure : AllocMemForDOS
 19229                                  ;
 19230                                  ;		Allocate memory for DOS/BIOS code from DOS !!!
 19231                                  ;
 19232                                  ;	Out : AX - seg of allocated memoryblock
 19233                                  ;
 19234                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19235                                  
 19236                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19237                                  
 19238                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 19239                                  
 19240                                  AllocMemForDOS:
 19241                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19242                                  	; 14/05/2019
 19243                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19244                                  	; ds = cs
 19245                                  	;mov	ax,BCode_end
 19246                                  	;sub	ax,BCode_start		; BIOS code size
 19247                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19248 000009EB B8001A                  	mov	ax,BCODE_END ; 1A60h	; 1A70h for MSDOS 6.21
 19249                                  					; 30/12/2022
 19250                                  	;sub	ax,BCODE_START ; 30h
 19251                                  	; 09/12/2022
 19252 000009EE 2D[3000]                	sub	ax,BCODESTART 
 19253                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 
 19254                                  	; 02/11/2022
 19255                                  	;add	ax,[cs:lo_doscod_size]	; DOS code size
 19256                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19257                                  	; ds = cs
 19258 000009F1 0306[7F02]              	add	ax,[lo_doscod_size]
 19259 000009F5 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 19260 000009F8 E86802                  	call	off_to_para			; convert to para
 19261                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19262                                  	; 14/05/2019
 19263                                  	;inc	ax ; + 1 paragraph for MCB
 19264 000009FB 09DB                    	or	bx,bx				; M012
 19265 000009FD 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax				;  can we use int 21 for alloc
 19266 000009FF 741A                    	jz	short update_arena		; M012
 19267 00000A01 B448                    	mov	ah,48h				; request DOS
 19268 00000A03 CD21                    	int	21h
 19269 00000A05 7250                    	jc	short FatalErr			; IF ERR WE ARE HOSED
 19270                                   	; 23/10/2022
 19271                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)
 19272 00000A07 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				; Take care ORG 30h of
 19273                                  						;  BIOS code
 19274 00000A0A 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19275                                  	;mov	word [es:20h+ARENA.OWNER],08h	; mark it as system
 19276                                  	;mov	word [es:20h+ARENA.NAME],'SC'	;  code area
 19277                                  	; 14/05/2019
 19278                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],08h	; mark it as system
 19279                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC'	;  code area
 19280                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19281 00000A0C 26C70621000800          	mov	word [es:20h+1],08h		; mark it as system
 19282 00000A13 26C70628005343          	mov	word [es:20h+8],'SC'		;  code area
 19283                                  
 19284 00000A1A C3                      	retn
 19285                                  
 19286                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 19287                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 19288                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 19289                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 19290                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 19291                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 19292                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 19293                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 19294                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 19295                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 19296                                  ;	  stub will go.
 19297                                  ;
 19298                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 19299                                  
 19300                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19301                                  update_arena:
 19302 00000A1B 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 19303 00000A1C 57                      	push	di
 19304 00000A1D 51                      	push	cx
 19305 00000A1E 52                      	push	dx
 19306                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19307                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 19308                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19309                                  	; ds = cs 
 19310 00000A1F C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 19311 00000A23 4F                      	dec	di
 19312 00000A24 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 19313                                  						;  before sysvar
 19314 00000A25 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 19315                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 19316 00000A27 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 19317 00000A2C 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 19318 00000A2E 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 19319                                  
 19320                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 19321 00000A30 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 19322 00000A35 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 19323 00000A37 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 19324 00000A39 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 19325 00000A3B 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19326                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 19327 00000A3D 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 19328                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 19329 00000A41 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 19330 00000A47 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 19331                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 19332 00000A49 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 19333 00000A4D 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 19334                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19335                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 19336 00000A4F 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 19337 00000A52 5A                      	pop	dx
 19338 00000A53 59                      	pop	cx
 19339 00000A54 5F                      	pop	di
 19340 00000A55 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 19341 00000A56 C3                      	retn
 19342                                  ;
 19343                                  ; M012 : END
 19344                                  ;
 19345                                  FatalErr:
 19346 00000A57 0E                      	push	cs
 19347 00000A58 1F                      	pop	ds
 19348 00000A59 BA[2109]                	mov	dx,FEmsg

 19364                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 19365                                  ;
 19366                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19367                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19368                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19369                                  ;
 19370                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 19371                                  ;
 19372                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19373                                  
 19374                                  AllocHMA:
 19375                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 19376                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 19377                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 19378                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 19379                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.

 19381                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 19382                                  ;

 19384                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)

 19386                                  ;	popf
 19387                                  ;	pushf

 19389                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)

 19533                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19534                                  ;
 19535                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19536                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19537                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19538                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19539                                  ;
 19540                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19541                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19542                                  ;
 19543                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19544                                  
 19545                                  StartVDHead:
 19546                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19547                                  
 19548 00000ADB 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19549 00000ADF 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19550 00000AE1 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19551 00000AE3 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19552 00000AE5 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19553                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19554 00000AE6 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19555                                  VDiskSig1:
 19556 00000AED 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19557                                  
 19558                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19559                                  
 19560 00000AF2 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19561                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19562 00000AF8 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19563 00000B07 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19564 00000B09 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 19565                                  VDInt19:
 19566 00000B0A EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 19567                                  OldVDInt19:
 19568 00000B0B 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 19569                                  
 19570                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 19571                                  
 19572                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 19573 00000B0F 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 19574                                  VDiskSig2:
 19575 00000B12 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19576                                  
 19577                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 19578                                  
 19579 00000B17 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 19580 00000B1A 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 19581 00000B1C 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 19582 00000B1D 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 19583 00000B1F 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 19584 00000B20 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 19585 00000B22 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 19586 00000B24 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 19587 00000B25 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 19588 00000B27 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 19589 00000B29 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 19590 00000B2B 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 19591 00000B2D 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 19592                                  
 19593                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 19594

 19596                                  ;
 19597                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 19598                                  ;
 19599                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 19600                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 19601                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 19602                                  ;
 19603                                  ; Inputs : None
 19604                                  ;
 19605                                  ; Outputs : None
 19606                                  ;
 19607                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 19608                                  ;
 19609                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19610                                  
 19611                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19612                                  
 19613                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 19614 00000B2F 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 19615 00000B31 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 19616                                  
 19617                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 19618                                  
 19619                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19620 00000B33 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 19621                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 19622 00000B36 2EA3[0B0B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 19623 00000B3A A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 19624                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19625 00000B3D 2EA3[0D0B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19626                                  
 19627                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 19628                                  
 19629 00000B41 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 19630                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 19631                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19632 00000B43 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 19633 00000B46 CD21                    	int	21h
 19634                                  
 19635                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 19636                                  
 19637 00000B48 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 19638 00000B49 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19639                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 19640 00000B4B 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 19641                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 19642 00000B52 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 19643 00000B59 40                      	inc	ax
 19644 00000B5A 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 19645                                  
 19646                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 19647                                  
 19648 00000B5C FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 19649                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 19650 00000B5D C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 19651 00000B63 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 19652                                  
 19653                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 19654                                  
 19655                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 19656 00000B66 B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 19657 00000B69 BE[DB0A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 19658 00000B6C 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 19659 00000B6E 0E                      	push	cs
 19660 00000B6F 1F                      	pop	ds
 19661 00000B70 FC                      	cld
 19662 00000B71 F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 19663 00000B73 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 19664                                  
 19665                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 19666                                  
 19667                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19668 00000B74 57                      	push	di
 19669 00000B75 06                      	push	es
 19670                                  
 19671 00000B76 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 19672 00000B79 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19673 00000B7B BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 19674                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)
 19675 00000B7E B92000                  	mov	cx,32
 19676 00000B81 BE[0F0B]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead

 19678                                  
 19679 00000B86 5F                      	pop	di
 19680 00000B87 07                      	pop	es
 19681

 19728                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIT1.ASM)
 19729                                  
 19730                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 19731                                  ; (SYSINIT:0CA6h)
 19732                                  
 19733                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 19734                                  
 19735                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19736                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 19737                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 19738                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 19739                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 19740                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 19741                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 19742                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 19743                                  ;								      ;I070
 19744                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 19745                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 19746                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 19747                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 19748                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 19749                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 19750                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 19751                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 19752                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 19753                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 19754                                  ;								      ;I070
 19755                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 19756                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19757                                  
 19758                                  	; 12/12/2022
 19759                                  	; ds = cs
 19760                                  
 19761                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 19762                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 19763                                  
 19764 00000BD9 06                      	push	es
 19765 00000BDA 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 19766 00000BDC 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 19767 00000BDE B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 19768 00000BE0 D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 19769 00000BE2 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 19770 00000BE4 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 19771 00000BE6 05[B90B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 19772 00000BE9 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 19773                                  
 19774                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 19775                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 19776                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax
 19777                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 19778                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+4],dl
 19779                                  	; 12/12/2022
 19780                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 19781 00000BEC A3[9B0B]                	mov	[src_desc+2],ax
 19782                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 19783 00000BEF 8816[9D0B]              	mov	[src_desc+4],dl
 19784                                  
 19785 00000BF3 B91000                  	mov	cx,16	; 16 words
 19786 00000BF6 0E                      	push	cs
 19787 00000BF7 07                      	pop	es
 19788 00000BF8 BE[890B]                	mov	si,bmove
 19789 00000BFB B487                    	mov	ah,87h
 19790 00000BFD CD15                    	int	15h	; EXTENDED MEMORY - BLOCK MOVE (AT,XT286,PS)
 19791                                  			; CX = number of words to move 
 19792                                  			; ES:SI -> global descriptor table
 19793                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AH = status
 19794 00000BFF 07                      	pop	es

 19797                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19798                                  ;
 19799                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 19800                                  ;
 19801                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 19802                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 19803                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 19804                                  ;		the offset.
 19805                                  ;
 19806                                  ; Inputs : ES:DI - pointer to free HMA
 19807                                  ; Output : FreeHMAPtr in BIOS data segment updated
 19808                                  ;
 19809                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19810                                  
 19811                                  SaveFreeHMAPtr:
 19812 00000C01 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es
 19813 00000C03 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh		; HMA segment
 19814 00000C06 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 19815 00000C08 83C70F                  	add	di,15			; para round
 19816 00000C0B 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 19817 00000C0E B104                    	mov	cl,4
 19818 00000C10 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 19819 00000C12 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 19820 00000C14 1E                      	push	ds
 19821                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 19822                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 19823                                  	; 21/10/2022
 19824 00000C15 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 19825 00000C18 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19826 00000C1A 893E[F508]              	mov	[FreeHMAPtr],di	   ; (ds:8F7h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 19827 00000C1E C606[0D00]FF            	mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 19828 00000C23 1F                      	pop	ds
 19829 00000C24 C3                      	retn

 19831                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19832                                  ;
 19833                                  ; procedure : IsVDiskInstalled
 19834                                  ;
 19835                                  ;		Checks for the presence of VDISK header at 1MB boundary
 19836                                  ;		& INT 19 vector
 19837                                  ;
 19838                                  ; Inputs  : A20 flag should be ON
 19839                                  ; Outputs : Zero set if VDISK header found else Zero cleared
 19840                                  ;
 19841                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19842

 19868                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19869                                  ;
 19870                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 19871                                  ;
 19872                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 19873                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 19874                                  ;
 19875                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19876                                  
 19877                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19878                                  CPMHack:
 19879 00000C4D 1E                      	push	ds
 19880 00000C4E B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 19881 00000C51 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = FFFF
 19882                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 19883                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19884 00000C53 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 19885 00000C54 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 19886 00000C56 BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 19887 00000C59 BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 19888                                  	;mov	cx,5
 19889 00000C5C B105                    	mov	cl,5
 19890 00000C5E FC                      	cld
 19891 00000C5F F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 19892 00000C61 1F                      	pop	ds
 19893 00000C62 C3                      	retn

 19996                                  ;	should handle the system that does not have any floppies.
 19997                                  ;	in this case,we are going to pretended there are two dummy floppies
 19998                                  ;	in the system. still they have dpb and cds,but we are going to
 19999                                  ;	0 out curdir_flags,curdir_devptr of cds so ibmdos can issue
 20000                                  ;	"invalid drive specification" message when the user try to
 20001                                  ;	access them.
 20002                                  ;

 20126                                  ; This procedure is called after the config.sys has been processed and

 20775                                  
 20776                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 20777                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 20778                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 20779                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 20780                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 20781                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 20782                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 20783                                  ;
 20784                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 20785                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 20786                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 20787                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 20788                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 20789                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 20790                                  ;
 20791                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 20792                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 20793                                  ;
 20794                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 20795                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 20796                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 20797                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 20798                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 20799                                  ;
 20800                                  ;	for round-up machine
 20801                                  ;
 20802                                  ;			  none.
 20803                                  
 20804                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 20805                                  ;
 20806                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 20807                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 20808                                  
 20809                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20810                                  
 20811 00001000 50                      	push	ax
 20812 00001001 53                      	push	bx
 20813 00001002 52                      	push	dx
 20814 00001003 06                      	push	es
 20815                                  
 20816 00001004 B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh 		;reset h/w by writing to port
 20817 00001006 BAF202                  	mov	dx,2F2h 		;get starting address
 20818 00001009 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f2h,0ffh
 20819 0000100A 42                      	inc	dx
 20820 0000100B EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f3h,0ffh
 20821 0000100C 42                      	inc	dx
 20822 0000100D EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f4h,0ffh
 20823 0000100E 42                      	inc	dx
 20824 0000100F EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f5h,0ffh
 20825 00001010 42                      	inc	dx
 20826 00001011 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f6h,0ffh
 20827 00001012 42                      	inc	dx
 20828 00001013 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f7h,0ffh

 20850 00001030 BAF206                  	mov	dx,6F2h 		;get starting address
 20851 00001033 EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f2h,0ffh
 20852 00001034 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 20853 00001035 EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f3h,0ffh
 20854 00001036 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 20855 00001037 EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f4h,0ffh
 20856 00001038 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 20857 00001039 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 20858 0000103A EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f6h,0ffh
 20859 0000103B 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 20860 0000103C EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f7h,0ffh

 21013                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21014                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 21015                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21016                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 21017                                  ;
 21018                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 21019                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 21020                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 21021                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 21022                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 21023                                  ; program).
 21024                                  
 21025                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 21026                                  
 21027                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 21028                                  
 21029 000010E8 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 21030                                  
 21031                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 21032                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 21033                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 21034                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 21035                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 21036                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 21037                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 21038                                  ; carridge return.
 21039                                  
 21040                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 21041                                  ;character after =.
 21042                                  
 21043 000010E9 06                      	push	es
 21044 000010EA 1E                      	push	ds
 21045 000010EB 07                      	pop	es
 21046 000010EC 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 21047 000010ED 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 21048                                  
 21049 000010EF 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21050 000010F1 FC                      	cld
 21051 000010F2 2EC606[EF02]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 21052 000010F8 BF[F002]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 21053                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 21054 000010FB AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 21055 000010FC 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 21056 000010FE 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 21057 00001100 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 21058                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 21059 00001102 AC                      	lodsb
 21060 00001103 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 21061 00001106 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 21062 00001108 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 21063 0000110A FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 21064 0000110C 47                      	inc	di
 21065 0000110D EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 21066                                  done_installparm:
 21067 0000110F 2E880E[EE02]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 21068 00001114 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 21069 00001117 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 21070 00001119 2EC606[EF02]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 21071                                  					; starts with cr.
 21072                                  install_seg_set:
 21073 0000111F 2EC70600000000          	mov	word [cs:0],0		; make a null environment segment
 21074 00001126 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs			; by overlap jmp instruction of sysinitseg.

 21152                                  
 21153                                  install_exit_ret:
 21154 00001168 C3                      	retn

 21174                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21175                                  
 21176                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 21177                                  ;
 21178                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 21179                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 21180                                  ;
 21181                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 21182                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 21183                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 21184                                  
 21185                                  ParaRound:
 21186 00001169 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 21187 0000116C D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 21188 0000116E D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21189 00001170 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21190 00001172 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21191 00001174 C3                      	retn
 21192                                  
 21193                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21194                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 21195                                  ;
 21196                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 21197                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 21198                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 21199                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21200                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21201                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21202                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21203                                  ;
 21204                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21205                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21206                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21207                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21208                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21209                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21210                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 21211                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21212                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21213                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21214                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21215                                  ;
 21216                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21217                                  
 21218                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21219                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21220                                  sysinit_base:				
 21221 00001175 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 21222 0000117A 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 21223 0000117F CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 21224 00001181 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 21225 00001186 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 21226 0000118B 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 21227 0000118C 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 21228 0000118D 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 21229                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 21230                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 21231 0000118F E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 21232 00001192 263906[D802]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 21233 00001197 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 21234                                  
 21235                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 21236                                  
 21237 00001199 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21238 0000119B 0E                      	push	cs
 21239 0000119C 1F                      	pop	ds
 21240                                  	; 30/12/2022
 21241                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 21242                                  	;mov	dx, 102
 21243 0000119D BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21244                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 21245 000011A0 CD21                    	int	21h
 21246                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21247                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21248                                  
 21249                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 21250                                  stall:
 21251                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21252                                  _stall: 
 21253                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21254 000011A2 F4                      	hlt 
 21255                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21256                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 21257 000011A3 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 21258                                  
 21259                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 21260 000011A5 26FF2E[D402]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 21261                                  
 21262                                  ;-------------------------------------
 21263                                  
 21264                                  sum_up:
 21265                                  
 21266                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21267                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21268                                  ;
 21269                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21270                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21271                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21272                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21273                                  ;
 21274                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21275                                  
 21276 000011AA 1E                      	push	ds
 21277                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 21278                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 21279 000011AB 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21280                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21281                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 21282 000011AF 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21283 000011B1 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21284 000011B3 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21285 000011B5 268B0E[CE02]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21286                                  					; whole test better fail.
 21287 000011BA D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21288 000011BC 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21289                                  sum1:
 21290 000011BE 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21291 000011C0 46                      	inc	si
 21292 000011C1 46                      	inc	si
 21293 000011C2 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21294                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21295                                  sum_sys_code:
 21296                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21297 000011C4 BEC411                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21298                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21299                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21300                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21301                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21302                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21303                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21304                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 21305 000011C7 B9[D04E]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 21306 000011CA 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 21307 000011CC D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 21308                                  sum2:
 21309 000011CE 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 21310 000011D1 46                      	inc	si
 21311 000011D2 46                      	inc	si
 21312 000011D3 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 21313 000011D5 1F                      	pop	ds
 21314 000011D6 C3                      	retn
 21315                                  
 21316                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21317                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21318                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 21319                                  
 21320                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 21321                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:			    ; = 62 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1290h) 	
 21322 000011D7 0000                    	dw	0
 21323                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 21324                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:			    ; = 64 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1292h)
 21325 000011D9 0000                    	dw	0

 21396                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0

 21412                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21413                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21414                                  ;
 21415                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 21416                                  ;

 21418                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA

 21423 00001250 53                      	push	bx
 21424 00001251 52                      	push	dx

 21426 00001256 2EF726[9702]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 21427                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 21428 0000125B 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 21429                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21430                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21431                                  	; 12/12/2022

 21433 00001260 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21434 00001262 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h

 21436 00001265 CD2F                    	int	2Fh

 21438 0000126A 7508                    	jne	short got_hma
 21439 0000126C BF0000                  	mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 21440                                  	;zf=1

 21442                                  	;zf=1
 21443 0000126F 2E8E06[6203]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 21444                                  got_hma:

 21446 00001275 5B                      	pop	bx
 21447 00001276 C3                      	retn

 21470 0000128C 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh

 21472 00001292 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0

 21474 00001298 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0

 21477                                  ; ======================================================================
 21478                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21479                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21480                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21481                                  
 21482                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21483                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21484                                  ;
 21485                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21486                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21487                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21488                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21489                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21490                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21491                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21492                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21493                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21494                                  ;
 21495                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21496                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21497                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21498                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21499                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21500                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21501                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21502                                  ;	conditions:
 21503                                  ;
 21504                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21505                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21506                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21507                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21508                                  ;
 21509                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21510                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21511                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21512                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21513                                  ;
 21514                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21515                                  ;
 21516                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21517                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21518                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21519                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21520                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21521                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21522                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21523                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21524                                  ;
 21525                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21526                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21527                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21528                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21529                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 21530                                  ;
 21531                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21532                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21533                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21534                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21535                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21536                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21537                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21538                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21539                                  ;
 21540                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21541                                  
 21542                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21543                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21544                                  
 21545                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21546                                  stackinit:
 21547 0000129F 50                      	push	ax
 21548 000012A0 1E                      	push	ds
 21549 000012A1 06                      	push	es
 21550 000012A2 53                      	push	bx
 21551 000012A3 51                      	push	cx
 21552 000012A4 52                      	push	dx
 21553 000012A5 57                      	push	di
 21554 000012A6 56                      	push	si
 21555 000012A7 55                      	push	bp
 21556                                  
 21557                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21558                                  
 21559                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21560                                  	; ds = cs
 21561 000012A8 A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 21562 000012AB 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 21563                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21564                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 21565                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 21566 000012AD 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 21567                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 21568 000012B1 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 21569 000012B4 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 21570                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21571 000012B8 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 21572                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21573                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21574                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 21575 000012BB 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 21576                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21577 000012BF 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 21578 000012C1 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 21579                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21580                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21581                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 21582 000012C4 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 21583                                  
 21584                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 21585                                  
 21586                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 21587                                  
 21588                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 21589                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21590                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 21591 000012C8 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 21592                                  
 21593                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 21594                                  
 21595 000012CD B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 21596                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 21597                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21598                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*

 22377                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22378                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22379                                  
 22380                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22381                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22382                                  
 22383                                  new_init_loop:
 22384                                  
 22385                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22386                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22387                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22388                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22389                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22390                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22391                                  
 22392 00001494 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22393 00001497 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22394 00001499 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22395 0000149D 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22396                                  
 22397 000014A0 1E                      	push	ds
 22398                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22399                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22400                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22401 000014A1 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22402 000014A4 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22403 000014A6 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22404 000014A9 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22405 000014AB 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22406 000014AF 894502                  	mov	word [di+2],ax
 22407 000014B2 1F                      	pop	ds
 22408                                  
 22409 000014B3 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22410 000014B6 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22411 000014BA C3                      	retn
 22412                                  
 22413                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 22414                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22415                                  
 22416                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22417                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 22418                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 22419                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 22420                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 22421                                  ;out: devmark established.
 22422                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 22423                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 22424                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22425                                  
 22426                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22427                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 22428                                  
 22429                                  setdevmark:
 22430                                  
 22431 000014BB 06                      	push	es
 22432 000014BC 51                      	push	cx
 22433                                  
 22434 000014BD 2E8B0E[6203]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22435 000014C2 2E890E[E214]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 22436 000014C7 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 22437                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22438                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 22439 000014C9 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 22440 000014CD 41                      	inc	cx
 22441                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 22442 000014CE 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 22443                                  
 22444 000014D3 59                      	pop	cx
 22445 000014D4 07                      	pop	es
 22446 000014D5 2EFF06[6203]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 22447 000014DA C3                      	retn
