 22682                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 22683                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 22684                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22685                                  
 22686                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 22687                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 22688 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 22689 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 22690 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 22691                                  endstruc
 22692                                  
 22693                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22694                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 22695                                  ;
 22696                                  ;
 22697                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 22698                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 22699                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22700                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22701                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22702                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22703                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22704                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22705                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22706                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22707                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22708                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 22709                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 22710                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 22711                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 22712                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 22713                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 22714                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 22715                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 22716                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 22717                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 22718                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 22719                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 22720                                  ;	   :
 22721                                  ;
 22722                                  ;Note:
 22723                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 22724                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22725                                  ;
 22726                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22727                                  ;
 22728                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22729                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22730                                  ;
 22731                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22732                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22733                                  ;
 22734                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22735                                  ;
 22736                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22737                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22738                                  ;
 22739                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22740                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22741                                  ;
 22742                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 22743                                  ;
 22744                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22745                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 22746                                  ;
 22747                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22748                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22749                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22750                                  ;
 22751                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 22752                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 22753                                  ;
 22754                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 22755                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 22756                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 22757                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22758                                  
 22759                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 22760                                  
 22761                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 22762                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 22763                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 22764                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 22765                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 22766                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 22767                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 22768                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 22769                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 22770                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 22771                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 22772                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 22773                                  
 22774                                  ;**** Function flags
 22775                                  
 22776                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 22777                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 22778                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 22779                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 22780                                  
 22781                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 22782                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 22783 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 22784 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 22785 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 22786 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 22787 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 22788 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 22789                                  endstruc
 22790                                  
 22791                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22792                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 22793                                  ;
 22794                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 22795                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 22796                                  ;	     +-
 22797                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 22798                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 22799                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 22800                                  ;	     |	:
 22801                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22802                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 22803                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 22804                                  ;	     |	:
 22805                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22806                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 22807                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 22808                                  ;	     +-	:
 22809                                  ;
 22810                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 22811                                  ;
 22812                                  ;Note:
 22813                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 22814                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 22815                                  ;
 22816                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22817                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22818                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22819                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22820                                  
 22821                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 22822                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 22823                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 22824                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 22825                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 22826                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 22827                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 22828                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 22829                                  
 22830                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 22831 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 22832 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 22833 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 22834 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 22835 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 22836                                  endstruc
 22837                                  
 22838                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22839                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 22840                                  ;
 22841                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 22842                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 22843                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 22844                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 22845                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 22846                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 22847                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 22848                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 22849                                  ;
 22850                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 22851                                  ;
 22852                                  ;            +-
 22853                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 22854                                  ;	    | or
 22855                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 22856                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 22857                                  ;	    | or
 22858                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 22859                                  ;	    | or
 22860                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 22861                                  ;	    | or
 22862                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 22863                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 22864                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 22865                                  ;	    | or
 22866                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 22867                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 22868                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 22869                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 22870                                  ;	    +-
 22871                                  ;
 22872                                  ;
 22873                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 22874                                  ;      list.
 22875                                  ;
 22876                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 22877                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 22878                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 22879                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22880                                  
 22881                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 22882                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 22883 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 22884 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 22885 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 22886 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 22887                                  endstruc
 22888                                  
 22889                                  ;--------------------------------
 22890                                  ;**** values for the type field in the result block
 22891                                  
 22892                                  _$P_EOL		   equ	0		;AN000; End of line

 22894                                  _$P_List_Idx	   equ	2		;AN000; List Index
 22895                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String
 22896                                  _$P_Complex	   equ	4		;AN000; Complex
 22897                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec
 22898                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive
 22899                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 22900                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 22901                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String
 22902                                  
 22903                                  _$P_No_Tag	   equ	0FFh		;AN000; No ITEM_TAG found
 22904

 22906                                  ;
 22907                                  ; following return code will be returned in the AX register.
 22908

 22910                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 22911                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 22912                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 22913                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 22914                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 22915                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 22916                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 22917                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 22918                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 23000                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 23001                                  ; ======================================================================
 23002                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23003                                  
 23004                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23005                                  ; SysParse;
 23006                                  ;
 23007                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23008                                  ;
 23009                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23010                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23011                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23012                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23013                                  ;
 23014                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23015                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23016                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23017                                  ;
 23018                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 23019                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 23020                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 23021                                  ;
 23022                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 23023                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 23024                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 23025                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 23026                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 23027                                  ;
 23028                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23029                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 23030                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 23031                                  ;
 23032                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 23033                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 23034                                  ;
 23035                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 23036                                  ;
 23037                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 23038                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 23039                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 23040                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 23041                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 23042                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 23043                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23044                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23045                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 23046                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 23047                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 23048                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 23049                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 23050                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 23051                                  ;	     (tm08)
 23052                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 23053                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 23054                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 23055                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 23056                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 23057                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 23058                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 23059                                  ;					  (tm12)
 23060                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 23061                                  ;					  (tm13)
 23062                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 23063                                  ;					  (tm14)
 23064                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 23065                                  ;					  (tm15)
 23066                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 23067                                  
 23068                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 23069                                  
 23070                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 23071                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 23072                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 23073                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 23074                                  
 23075                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 23076                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 23077                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 23078                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 23079                                  ;
 23080                                  
 23081                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 23082                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 23083                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 23084                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 23085                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 23086                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 23087                                  
 23088                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 23089                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 23090                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 23091                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 23092                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 23093                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 23094                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 23095                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 23096                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 23097

 23629                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23630                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 23631                                  ;
 23632                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 23633                                  ;
 23634                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 23635                                  ;	    AL = type
 23636                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 23637                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 23638                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 23639                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 23640                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 23641                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 23642                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 23643                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23644                                  ;
 23645                                  ; Output:   None
 23646                                  ;
 23647                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 23648                                  ;
 23649                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 23650                                  ;***********************************************************************

 23664                                  _$P_RLT04:				;AN000;

 24019                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24020                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 24021                                  ;
 24022                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 24023                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 24024                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 24025                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling

 24029                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block

 24039                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 24040                                  
 24041                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here

 24048

 24051

 24053                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;

 24957                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24958                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 24959                                  ;
 24960                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 24961                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 24962                                  ;
 24963                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24964                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 24965                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 24966                                  ;
 24967                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 24968                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 24969                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 24970                                  
 24971                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 24972                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 24973                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 24974                                  ;
 24975                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 24976                                  
 24977                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 24978                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24979                                  
 24980                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 24981                                  	;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 24982 00001D47 8D2E[0115]              	lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 24983                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 24984 00001D4B 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 24985 00001D4D 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 24986                                  
 24987                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 24988 00001D4F 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24989 00001D51 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 24990                                  
 24991 00001D53 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 24992                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24993                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24994 00001D54 C3                      	retn
 24995                                  
 24996                                  ; 12/12/2022
 24997                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 24998                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 24999                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25000                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 25001                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25002                                  
 25003                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 25004                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 25005 00001D55 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25006 00001D57 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 25007                                  
 25008 00001D59 2E800E[F814]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 25009                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25010                                  
 25011                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25012                                  	; cf=0
 25013                                  	;retn
 25014                                  
 25015                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 25016                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25017                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 25018 00001D5F F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 25019                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25020                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 25021 00001D60 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25022                                  
 25023                                  ;**************************************************************************
 25024                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25025                                  ;
 25026                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 25027                                  ;
 25028                                  ;  Input:
 25029                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 25030                                  ;
 25031                                  ;  Output:
 25032                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 25033                                  ;
 25034                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 25035                                  ;
 25036                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 25037                                  ;***************************************************************************
 25038                                  
 25039                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25040 00001D61 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 25041 00001D62 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25042 00001D63 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25043                                  	
 25044 00001D64 2E833E[F514]00          	cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 25045 00001D6A 7527                    	jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 25046                                  
 25047 00001D6C 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25048 00001D6D 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25049 00001D6E 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25050 00001D6F 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25051 00001D70 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 25052 00001D71 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 25053 00001D72 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 25054 00001D73 31F6                    	xor	si,si			;AN000;
 25055 00001D75 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si			;AN000;
 25056 00001D77 B80063                  	MOV	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 25057 00001D7A CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 25058                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 25059 00001D7C 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25060 00001D7E 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25061 00001D80 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 25062 00001D81 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 25063 00001D82 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 25064 00001D83 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 25065 00001D84 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25066 00001D85 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25067 00001D86 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25068 00001D87 7429                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 25069                                  
 25070                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 25071 00001D89 2E8936[F314]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 25072 00001D8E 2E891E[F514]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 25073                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 25074 00001D93 2E8B36[F314]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 25075 00001D98 2E8E1E[F514]            	mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 25076                                  
 25077                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 25078 00001D9D 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 25079 00001DA0 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 25080                                  
 25081 00001DA2 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 25082 00001DA4 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 25083                                  
 25084 00001DA6 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 25085 00001DA9 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 25086                                  
 25087 00001DAB F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 25088 00001DAC EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 25089                                  
 25090                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 25091 00001DAE 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 25092 00001DAF 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 25093                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 25094 00001DB0 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 25095                                  
 25096                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 25097                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25098                                  	; cf=0
 25099                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 25100                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 25101 00001DB2 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25102 00001DB3 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25103 00001DB4 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 25104 00001DB5 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25105

 25662                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 25663                                  
 25664                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25665                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25666                                  
 25667                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 25668                                  ;
 25669                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 25670                                  ;
 25671                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25672                                  ;
 25673                                  ;   Modification log:
 25674                                  ;
 25675                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 25676                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 25677                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 25678                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 25679                                  ;
 25680                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25681                                  ;
 25682                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 25683                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 25684                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 25685                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 25686                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 25687                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 25688                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 25689                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 25690                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 25691                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 25692                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 25693                                  ;
 25694                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25695                                  
 25696                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 25697                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 25698                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 25699                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 25700                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 25701                                  
 25702                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 25703                                  
 25704                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 25705                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 25706                                  
 25707                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 25708                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 25709                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 25710                                  
 25711                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 25712                                  ;
 25713                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 25714                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 25715                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 25716                                  ;	           line.
 25717                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 25718                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 25719                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 25720                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 25721                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 25722                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 25723                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 25724                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 25725                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 25726                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 25727                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 25728                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 25729                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 25730                                  ;	           for details).
 25731                                  
 25732 00001FB5 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 25733 00001FB6 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 25734 00001FB7 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 25735 00001FB9 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 25736 00001FBA 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 25737 00001FCA 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 25738 00001FEA 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 25739 00001FEB 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 25740 00001FEC 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 25741                                  
 25742                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 25743                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 25744                                  
 25745                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 25746                                  
 25747                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 25748                                  
 25749                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****

 25755                                  ; (SYSINIT:212Bh)

 25758                                  
 25759 00001FED 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 25760 00001FEF 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 25761 00001FF1 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 25762 00001FF3 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 25763 00001FF7 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver

 25769 00001FFD 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 25770 00001FFF 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)

 25797                                  
 25798                                  ; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25799                                  
 25800                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25801                                  ; (SYSINIT:215Eh)
 25802                                  
 25803                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25804                                  ;
 25805                                  ; procedure : doconf
 25806                                  ;
 25807                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 25808                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .
 25809                                  ;
 25810                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25811                                  
 25812                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25813                                  doconf:
 25814 00002021 0E                      	push	cs
 25815 00002022 1F                      	pop	ds
 25816                                  
 25817 00002023 B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 25818                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 25819 00002026 CD21                    	int	21h
 25820 00002028 8816[9247]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 25821                                  
 25822                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21  IO.SYS)
 25823                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25824                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25825                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 25826 0000202C 8816[9047]              	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 25827                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 25828                                  
 25829 00002030 BA[A746]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ;now pointing to file description
 25830 00002033 B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 25831                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		;open file "config.sys"
 25832 00002036 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 25833 00002037 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 25834 00002039 7309                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 25835                                  
 25836                                  ; 31/12/2022
 25837                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25838                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25839 0000203B E85C19                  	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 25840                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 25841                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 25842 0000203E C606[CB02]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 25843 00002043 C3                      	retn
 25844                                  noprob: 				;get file size (note < 64k!!)
 25845 00002044 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 25846 00002046 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 25847 00002048 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25848                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 25849 0000204A B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 25850 0000204D CD21                    	int	21h
 25851 0000204F A3[5403]                	mov	[count],ax
 25852                                  
 25853 00002052 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25854                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 25855 00002054 B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 25856 00002057 CD21                    	int	21h
 25857                                  
 25858                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 
 25859 00002059 8B16[A302]              	mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 25860                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25861                                  	;mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 25862                                  
 25863 0000205D A1[5403]                	mov	ax,[count]
 25864 00002060 A3[CE02]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 25865 00002063 E803F1                  	call	ParaRound
 25866 00002066 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 25867                                  
 25868                                  ; 31/12/2022
 25869                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25870                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25871                                  ;
 25872                                  ;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 25873                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 25874                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 25875                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 25876                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 25877                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 25878                                  ;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 25879                                  ;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 25880                                  ;
 25881 00002068 4A                      	dec	dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 25882 00002069 8916[DD14]              	mov	[config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 25883 0000206D 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 25884                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 25885

 26035 0000210A 50                              push    ax                      ;
 26036 0000210B E8AF08                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,

 26043                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 26044                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 26045                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 26046                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 26047                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 26048                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 26049                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 26050                                  ;   spot.
 26051                                  ;
 26052                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 26053                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 26054                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 26055                                  ;   retrieved.

 26252                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26253                                  ; buffer command
 26254                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26255                                  
 26256                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26257                                  ;									      *
 26258                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 26259                                  ;									      *
 26260                                  ; input :								      *
 26261                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26262                                  ; output:								      *
 26263                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 26264                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 26265                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 26266                                  ;									      *
 26267                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 26268                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 26269                                  ; logic:								      *
 26270                                  ; {									      *
 26271                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 26272                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 26273                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 26274                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 26275                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 26276                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 26277                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 26278                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 26279                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 26280                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 26281                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 26282                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 26283                                  ;	};								      *
 26284                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 26285                                  ; };									      *
 26286                                  ;									      *
 26287                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26288                                  
 26289                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26290                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 26291                                  tryb:
 26292 000021E5 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 26293 000021E8 755C                    	jne	short tryc
 26294                                  
 26295                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 26296                                  ; (SYSINIT:24BFh)
 26297                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26298                                  ;%if 0
 26299                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26300 000021EA E8BD1F                  	call	query_user		; query the user if config_cmd
 26301 000021ED 7257                    	jc	short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26302                                  ;endif
 26303                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 26304                                  
 26305                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26306                                  	; 18/12/2022
 26307 000021EF 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 26308                                  	;mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; 31/03/2019
 26309 000021F1 880E[FD1D]              	mov	[p_buffer_slash_x],cl ; 0
 26310                                  
 26311 000021F5 BF[B61D]                	mov	di,buf_parms
 26312                                  	;xor	cx,cx	; 18/12/2022
 26313                                  	; 03/01/2023
 26314                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 26315                                  do7:
 26316 000021F8 E86B07                  	call	sysinit_parse
 26317 000021FB 7303                    	jnc	short if7		; parse error,
 26318                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  and show messages and end the search loop.
 26319                                  	;;jmp	short sr7
 26320                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26321                                  ;sr7:
 26322                                  	;jmp	coff
 26323                                  	; 03/01/2023
 26324 000021FD E9AD06                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 26325                                  if7:
 26326 00002200 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL ; 0FFFFh	; end of line?
 26327 00002203 741A                    	je	short en7		;  then jmp to $endloop for semantic check
 26328                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x
 26329 00002205 813E[011E][F61D]        	cmp	word [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],switch_x
 26330                                  	;jne	short if11
 26331                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26332 0000220B 74EB                    	je	short do7 ;je short en11

 26335                                  	;jmp	short en11 ; 31/12/2022

 26337                                  	;mov	ax,[rv_dword]
 26338 0000220D A1[031E]                	mov	ax,[result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val]

 26381                                  
 26382                                  ;****************************************************************************
 26383                                  ;									    *
 26384                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 26385                                  ;									    *
 26386                                  ; input :								    *
 26387                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 26388                                  ; output:								    *
 26389                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *

 26398                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 26399                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 26400                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *

 26402                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 26403                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *

 26405                                  ;	};								    *

 26408                                  ; };									    *

 27029                                  ;	Note: sysi_numio (in DOS DATA) currently reflects the REAL
 27030                                  ;	number of installed devices (including DblSpace drives) where
 27031                                  ;	"drivenumber" is the number that the next block device will
 27032                                  ;	be assigned to. Because some naughty device drivers (like
 27033                                  ;	interlnk) look at the internal DOS variable instead of the
 27034                                  ;	value we pass it, we'll temporarily stick our value into
 27035                                  ;	DOS DATA while we're initializing the device drivers.
 27036                                  ;
 27037                                  ;	Note that this will make it impossible for this device
 27038                                  ;	driver to access the DblSpace drive letters, whether
 27039                                  ;	they are swapped-hosts or unswapped compressed drives,
 27040                                  ;	during its initialization phase.

 27958                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27959                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 27960                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 27961                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 27962                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 27963                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 27964                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 27965                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 27966                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27967                                  
 27968                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27969                                  ;									  *
 27970                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 27971                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 27972                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 27973                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 27974                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 27975                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 27976                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 27977                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 27978                                  ; input :								  *
 27979                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 27980                                  ; output:								  *
 27981                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 27982                                  ;									  *
 27983                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 27984                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 27985                                  ; logic:								  *
 27986                                  ; {									  *
 27987                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 27988                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 27989                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 27990                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 27991                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 27992                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 27993                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27994                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 27995                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27996                                  ;	     }								  *
 27997                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 27998                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 27999                                  ;	};								  *
 28000                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 28001                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 28002                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 28003                                  ; };									  *
 28004                                  ;**************************************************************************
 28005

 28738                                  sysinit_parse:
 28739                                  
 28740                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28741                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 28742                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 28743                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 28744                                  ;
 28745                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 28746                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 28747                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 28748                                  ;	*** after each call.
 28749                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 28750                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 28751                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 28752                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 28753                                  ;	 procedure.

 29088                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 29089                                  ;
 29090                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 29091                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 29092                                  ;
 29093                                  ;	Output : none
 29094                                  ;
 29095                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 29096                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 29097                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29098                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 29099                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h

 29110 00002A2C 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 29111                                  	; 13/05/2019
 29112                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 29113                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 29114                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB

 29120                                  lim_set:

 29129                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29130                                  ;
 29131                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 29132                                  ;
 29133                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 29134                                  ;	Output : none
 29135                                  ;
 29136                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 29137                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 29138                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 29139                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 29140                                  ;
 29141                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29142                                  
 29143                                  	; 01/11/2022
 29144                                  SetInt12Mem:
 29145 00002A38 1E                      	push	ds
 29146 00002A39 BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 29147 00002A3C 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 29148 00002A3E 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 29149 00002A42 2E891E[0F20]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 29150 00002A47 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 29151 00002A49 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 29152 00002A4B A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 29153 00002A4E 2EC606[0E20]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 29154 00002A54 1F                      	pop	ds
 29155                                  ;limx:
 29156 00002A55 C3                      	retn
 29157                                  
 29158                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29159                                  ;
 29160                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 29161                                  ;
 29162                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 29163                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 29164                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 29165                                  ;
 29166                                  ;	Output : none
 29167                                  ;
 29168                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 29169                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 29170                                  ;
 29171                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29172                                  
 29173                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 29174                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29175                                  	; ds = cs
 29176 00002A56 803E[0E20]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29177                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 29178                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 29179                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 29180 00002A5B 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 29181                                  	; 18/12/2022
 29182 00002A5D B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 29183 00002A60 8826[0E20]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 29184                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29185                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 29186 00002A64 1E                      	push	ds
 29187                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 29188 00002A65 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 29189 00002A67 2EA1[0F20]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 29190 00002A6B A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 29191 00002A6E 1F                      	pop	ds
 29192                                  timx:
 29193 00002A6F C3                      	retn
