 29246                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 29247                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 29248                                  
 29249                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 29250                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 29251                                  
 29252                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29253                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 29254                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29255                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29256                                  
 29257                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29258                                  ;
 29259                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 29260                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 29261                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 29262                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 29263                                  ;
 29264                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 29265                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 29266                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 29267                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 29268                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 29269                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 29270                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 29271                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 29272                                  ; available during the load.
 29273                                  ;
 29274                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 29275                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 29276                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 29277                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 29278                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 29279                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 29280                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 29281                                  ;
 29282                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 29283                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 29284                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 29285                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 29286                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 29287                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 29288                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 29289                                  ;
 29290                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29291                                  
 29292                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 29293                                  
 29294                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 29295                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 29296                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 29297                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 29298                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 29299                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 29300                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 29301                                  
 29302                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 29303                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 29304                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 29305                                  
 29306                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29307                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 29308                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29309                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 29310                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 29311                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 29312                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29313                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29314                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 29315                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 29316                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29317                                  
 29318                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 29319                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 29320                                  
 29321                                  InitVar:
 29322                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29323                                  	; ds = cs
 29324

 29326                                  	; 03/01/2023
 29327                                  	;push	ax
 29328                                  	;push	cx
 29329                                  	;push	di
 29330 00002A9A 06                      	push	es
 29331                                  
 29332                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 29333 00002A9B 0E                      	push	cs

 29335                                  
 29336 00002A9D 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 29337                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 29338                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 29339                                  	;mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only

 29341                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 29342                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 29343                                  
 29344                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29345                                  	; ds = cs
 29346 00002A9F A2[B61F]                	mov	[fUmbTiny],al		;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 29347 00002AA2 A2[B51F]                	mov	[fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 29348 00002AA5 A3[B71F]                	mov	[SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 29349 00002AA8 C606[B91F]FF            	mov	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 29350                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 29351 00002AAD A2[EC1F]                	mov	[fm_argc], al		;Start with zero args having been read
 29352

 29355 00002AB1 B91000                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry

 29364

 29368 00002AC0 07                      	pop	es

 29372                                  	;pop	ax

 29376                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29377                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 29378                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29379                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 29380                                  ; EXIT    : None
 29381                                  ; ERROR   : None
 29382                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 29383                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29384                                  
 29385                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 29386                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 29387                                  FixMem:
 29388                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29389                                  	;push	ax
 29390                                  	;push	bx
 29391                                  	;push	cx
 29392                                  	;push	dx
 29393 00002AC2 06                      	push	es
 29394                                  
 29395 00002AC3 E84B00                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 29396                                  
 29397 00002AC6 E80E02                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 29398 00002AC9 7241                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 29399                                  
 29400 00002ACB 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 29401                                  
 29402                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 29403                                  
 29404 00002ACD 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 29405 00002ACF 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 29406 00002AD1 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 29407                                  
 29408                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29409                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 29410                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 29411                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29412                                  
 29413 00002AD2 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 29414 00002AD6 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 29415 00002ADB 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 29416 00002ADD 7518                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 29417                                  
 29418                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 29419                                  
 29420 00002ADF 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 29421 00002AE4 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 29422 00002AE6 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 29423                                  
 29424 00002AEA 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 29425 00002AEF 83C301                  	add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 29426 00002AF2 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 29427                                  
 29428                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 29429                                  
 29430 00002AF7 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 29431 00002AF9 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 29432                                  
 29433 00002AFE 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 29434 00002B00 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 29435 00002B05 43                      	inc	bx
 29436 00002B06 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 29437                                  
 29438                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 29439 00002B08 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 29440 00002B0A 75C6                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 29441                                  fmX:	
 29442 00002B0C E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 29443                                  
 29444 00002B0F 07                      	pop	es
 29445                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29446                                  	;pop	dx
 29447                                  	;pop	cx
 29448                                  	;pop	bx
 29449                                  	;pop	ax
 29450                                  
 29451 00002B10 C3                      	retn
 29452                                  
 29453                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29454                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 29455                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29456                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29457                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 29458                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29459                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 29460                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29461                                  
 29462                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 29463                                  fm_link:
 29464 00002B11 B80258                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 29465 00002B14 CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 29466                                  
 29467                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 29468                                  	;
 29469                                  	;push	es
 29470                                  	;push	cs
 29471                                  	;pop	es
 29472                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 29473                                  	;pop	es
 29474                                  	
 29475                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29476                                  	; ds = cs
 29477                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 29478 00002B16 A2[EA1F]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 29479                                  
 29480 00002B19 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29481 00002B1C BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 29482 00002B1F CD21                    	int	21h
 29483 00002B21 C3                      	retn
 29484                                  
 29485                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29486                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 29487                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29488                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 29489                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29490                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29491                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 29492                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29493                                  
 29494                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 29495                                  fm_unlink:
 29496 00002B22 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 29497                                  	
 29498                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 29499                                  	;
 29500                                  	;push	ds
 29501                                  	;push	cs
 29502                                  	;pop	ds
 29503                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 29504                                  	;pop	ds
 29505                                  	
 29506                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29507                                  	; ds = cs
 29508                                  	;mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 29509 00002B24 8A1E[EA1F]              	mov	bl,[fm_umb]
 29510                                  
 29511 00002B28 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29512 00002B2B CD21                    	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 29513 00002B2D C3                      	retn
 29514                                  
 29515                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29516                                  
 29517                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29518                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 29519                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 29520                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29521                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 29522                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 29523                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 29524                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29525                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29526                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 29527                                  ;
 29528                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 29529                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 29530                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29531                                  ;
 29532                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 29533                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 29534                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 29535                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 29536                                  ;
 29537                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 29538                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 29539                                  ;
 29540                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29541                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 29542                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 29543                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 29544                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 29545                                  ;     lh
 29546                                  ;     /l
 29547                                  ;     1
 29548                                  ;     1000
 29549                                  ;     2
 29550                                  ;     print
 29551                                  ;     /d
 29552                                  ;     :lpt2
 29553                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 29554                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 29555                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 29556                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 29557                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 29558                                  ; for:
 29559                                  ;    Each /L
 29560                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 29561                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 29562                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 29563                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 29564                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 29565                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29566                                  
 29567                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 29568                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 29569                                  
 29570                                  ParseVar:
 29571                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 29572                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29573                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 29574 00002B2E 1E                      	push	ds
 29575 00002B2F 06                      	push	es
 29576                                  
 29577 00002B30 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 29578 00002B31 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 29579 00002B32 FC                      	cld
 29580                                  
 29581                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29582                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 29583                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29584                                  
 29585 00002B33 AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 29586 00002B34 E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 29587 00002B37 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 29588                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29589 00002B39 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 29590 00002B3B 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 29591                                  
 29592 00002B3D 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 29593 00002B3E F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 29594 00002B3F EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 29595                                  
 29596 00002B41 AC                      pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 29597                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 29598 00002B42 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 29599                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 29600 00002B44 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 29601 00002B46 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 29602                                  
 29603                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29604 00002B48 2EFE06[EC1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29605                                  
 29606                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 29607                                  	;
 29608                                  	;push	es
 29609                                  	;push	cs
 29610                                  	;pop	es
 29611                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 29612                                  	;pop	es
 29613                                  
 29614 00002B4D 2EC606[B61F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 29615                                  
 29616 00002B53 EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 29617                                  
 29618                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 29619 00002B55 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 29620 00002B57 750D                    	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 29621                                  
 29622                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29623 00002B59 2EFE06[EC1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29624                                  
 29625 00002B5E E80E00                  	call	parseL
 29626 00002B61 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 29627                                  
 29628 00002B63 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 29629 00002B64 EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 29630                                  
 29631                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 29632 00002B66 B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29633 00002B69 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 29634 00002B6A 4E                      	dec	si
 29635 00002B6B F9                      	stc
 29636                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 29637 00002B6C 07                      	pop	es
 29638 00002B6D 1F                      	pop	ds
 29639                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29640                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 29641 00002B6E C3                      	retn
 29642                                  
 29643                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29644                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 29645                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29646                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 29647                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 29648                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 29649                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 29650                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29651                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 29652                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 29653                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 29654                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 29655                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29656                                  
 29657                                  parseL:
 29658 00002B6F AC                      	lodsb
 29659 00002B70 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 29660 00002B72 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 29661                                  
 29662                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29663                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 29664                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29665                                  
 29666 00002B74 E8E700                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 29667 00002B77 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 29668 00002B79 E8B601                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 29669                                  
 29670 00002B7C 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 29671 00002B7E E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 29672 00002B81 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 29673                                  
 29674                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 29675 00002B83 2EFE06[EC1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29676                                  
 29677 00002B88 AC                      	lodsb
 29678 00002B89 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 29679 00002B8B 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 29680                                  
 29681 00002B8D E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 29682 00002B90 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 29683                                  
 29684 00002B92 E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 29685 00002B95 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29686                                  
 29687                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29688 00002B97 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 29689 00002B99 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 29690                                  
 29691 00002B9B 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 29692 00002B9D 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 29693                                  
 29694                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 29695                                  
 29696 00002B9F E8BC00                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 29697 00002BA2 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 29698                                  
 29699 00002BA4 E82201                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 29700                                  
 29701 00002BA7 E87200                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 29702                                  
 29703                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 29704 00002BAA 2EFE06[EC1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29705                                  
 29706 00002BAF AC                      	lodsb
 29707 00002BB0 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 29708 00002BB2 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 29709                                  
 29710 00002BB4 E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 29711 00002BB7 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 29712                                  
 29713 00002BB9 E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 29714 00002BBC 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29715                                  
 29716                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29717 00002BBE 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 29718 00002BC0 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 29719                                  plE1:	
 29720                                  	;mov	ax,1
 29721 00002BC2 B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 29722 00002BC5 4E                      	dec	si
 29723 00002BC6 F9                      	stc
 29724 00002BC7 C3                      	retn
 29725                                  
 29726                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 29727 00002BC8 B80200                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 29728                                  	; 12/12/2022
 29729                                  	; cf=1
 29730                                  	;stc
 29731 00002BCB C3                      	retn
 29732                                  plSwX:	
 29733 00002BCC 4E                      	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 29734                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 29735                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 29736                                  	; cf=0
 29737                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 29738 00002BCD C3                      	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 29739                                  
 29740                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29741                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 29742                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29743                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29744                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29745                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29746                                  ; USES:     fm_argc, flags
 29747                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29748                                  
 29749                                  ;incArgc:
 29750                                  	;push	ax
 29751

 29765                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29766                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29767                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29768                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29769                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29770                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29771                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29772                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29773                                  
 29774                                  isEOL:
 29775 00002BCE 3C00                    	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 29776 00002BD0 7406                    	je	short ieX
 29777 00002BD2 3C0D                    	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 29778 00002BD4 7402                    	je	short ieX
 29779 00002BD6 3C0A                    	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 29780                                  ieX:	
 29781 00002BD8 C3                      	retn
 29782                                  
 29783                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29784                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 29785                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29786                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29787                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 29788                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29789                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29790                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29791                                  
 29792                                  isWhite:
 29793 00002BD9 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 29794 00002BDB 7406                    	je	short iwX
 29795 00002BDD 3C3D                    	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 29796 00002BDF 7402                    	je	short iwX
 29797 00002BE1 3C09                    	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 29798                                  iwX:	
 29799 00002BE3 C3                      	retn

 29852                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29853                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 29854                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 29855                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 29856                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 29857                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29858                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 29859                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29860                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 29861                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29862                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29863                                  
 29864                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 29865                                  stowUMB:
 29866 00002BF7 3C10                    	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 29867 00002BF9 7202                    	jb	short su10
 29868 00002BFB F9                      	stc
 29869 00002BFC C3                      	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 29870                                  su10:	
 29871                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29872                                  	;push	bx
 29873                                  	;push	di
 29874                                  	;push	si
 29875                                  	;push	ds
 29876                                  	;push	es
 29877                                  	;push	cs
 29878                                  	;pop	es
 29879                                  	;push	cs
 29880                                  	;pop	ds
 29881                                  
 29882                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29883                                  	; ds <> cs
 29884                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],0FFh
 29885 00002BFD 2E803E[B91F]FF          	cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED
 29886                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
 29887 00002C03 7504                    	jne	short su20
 29888 00002C05 2EA2[B91F]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 29889                                  
 29890                                  	;;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 29891                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 29892                                  	;jne	short su20
 29893                                  	;mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 29894                                  su20:	
 29895 00002C09 08C0                    	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 29896 00002C0B 740E                    	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 29897                                  
 29898                                  	;mov	bl,al
 29899                                  	;xor	bh,bh
 29900                                  	;mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 29901                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29902 00002C0D 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 29903 00002C0F 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 29904 00002C11 B001                    	mov	al,1
 29905                                  
 29906                                  	;xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 29907                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29908 00002C13 2E8687[BA1F]            	xchg	[cs:bx+UmbUsed],al
 29909                                  
 29910                                  	;or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 29911                                  	;jz	short su30	; means an error.
 29912                                  	;
 29913                                  	;stc			; OOOPS!  This one's been used before.  :(
 29914                                  	
 29915                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29916 00002C18 3C01                    	cmp	al,1
 29917 00002C1A F5                      	cmc 	; if al > 0 -> cf = 1
 29918                                  su30:	
 29919                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29920                                  	;pop	es
 29921                                  	;pop	ds
 29922                                  	;pop	si
 29923                                  	;pop	di
 29924                                  	;pop	bx
 29925 00002C1B C3                      	retn
 29926

 29928                                  ;*** stowSiz - marks a given UMB as having a given minimum size
 29929                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29930                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains UMB number, AX contains size
 29931                                  ; EXIT:     None

 29949 00002C1E B700                    	mov	bh,0			;     bx==UMB number, AX==size
 29950 00002C20 D0E3                    	shl	bl,1			;     bx==offset into array, AX=size
 29951                                  	;mov	[es:bx+UmbSize],ax	; Store the size

 29961                                  
 29962                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29963                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 29964                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 29965                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 29966                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 29967                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29968                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 29969                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 29970                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 29971                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 29972                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29973                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 29974                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 29975                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 29976                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29977                                  
 29978                                  gnradix:
 29979 00002C28 0000                    	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 29980                                  
 29981                                  toDigit:
 29982 00002C2A 2E833E[282C]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 29983 00002C30 751C                    	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 29984                                  
 29985                                  toDigit_hex:
 29986 00002C32 80F961                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 29987 00002C35 7209                    	jb	short td10
 29988 00002C37 80F966                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 29989 00002C3A 7720                    	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 29990 00002C3C 80E957                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 29991                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29992 00002C3F C3                      	retn
 29993                                  td10:	
 29994 00002C40 80F941                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 29995 00002C43 7209                    	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 29996 00002C45 80F946                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 29997 00002C48 7712                    	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 29998 00002C4A 80E937                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 29999                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 30000 00002C4D C3                      	retn
 30001                                  toDigit_dec:
 30002                                  td20:	
 30003 00002C4E 80F930                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 30004                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 30005 00002C51 720A                    	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 30006 00002C53 80F939                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 30007 00002C56 7704                    	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 30008 00002C58 80E930                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 30009                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 30010 00002C5B C3                      	retn
 30011                                  tdE:	
 30012 00002C5C F9                      	stc
 30013                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 30014 00002C5D C3                      	retn
 30015                                  
 30016                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30017                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 30018                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30019                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 30020                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 30021                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 30022                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 30023                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30024                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 30025                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 30026                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 30027                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30028                                  
 30029                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30030                                  
 30031                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30032                                  ; (SYSINIT:3109h)
 30033                                  
 30034                                  GetXNum:
 30035                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 30036                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30037                                  	;push	bx
 30038 00002C5E 51                      	push	cx ; *
 30039                                  	;push	ds
 30040                                  
 30041 00002C5F FC                      	cld
 30042 00002C60 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 30043 00002C62 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 30044 00002C64 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 30045 00002C66 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 30046                                  
 30047 00002C68 2EC706[282C]0A00        	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 30048                                  
 30049 00002C6F 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 30050                                  	;call	toDigit
 30051 00002C72 E8D9FF                  	call	toDigit_dec
 30052                                  	;jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 30053                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30054 00002C75 7233                    	jc	short gxnX
 30055                                  
 30056 00002C77 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 30057 00002C79 7517                    	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 30058 00002C7B 268A4C01                	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 30059 00002C7F 80F978                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 30060 00002C82 7405                    	je	short gxn10
 30061 00002C84 80F958                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 30062 00002C87 7509                    	jne	short gxn20
 30063                                  
 30064                                  gxn10:	
 30065 00002C89 2EC706[282C]1000        	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 30066 00002C90 46                      	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 30067 00002C91 46                      	inc	si
 30068                                  
 30069                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 30070                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 30071                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 30072                                  ;        BX    = 0
 30073                                  ;        CH    = 0
 30074                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 30075                                  
 30076                                  gxn20:	
 30077 00002C92 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 30078 00002C95 46                      	inc	si
 30079                                  
 30080 00002C96 E891FF                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 30081 00002C99 720D                    	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 30082                                  
 30083 00002C9B E80E00                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 30084 00002C9E 720A                    	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 30085                                  
 30086 00002CA0 01C8                    	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 30087 00002CA2 11DA                    	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 iff last add wrapped
 30088                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 30089                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 30090 00002CA4 73EC                    	jnc	short gxn20
 30091                                  gxnE:	
 30092                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 30093 00002CA6 EB02                    	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 30094                                  gxnQ:	
 30095 00002CA8 4E                      	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 30096 00002CA9 F8                      	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 30097                                  gxnX:	
 30098                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30099                                  	;pop	ds
 30100 00002CAA 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 30101                                  	;pop	bx
 30102 00002CAB C3                      	retn
 30103                                  
 30104                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30105                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 30106                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30107                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 30108                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 30109                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 30110                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 30111                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30112                                  
 30113                                  mul32:
 30114 00002CAC 50                      	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 30115 00002CAD 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 30116 00002CAF 2EF726[282C]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 30117 00002CB4 7211                    	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 30118                                  
 30119 00002CB6 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 30120 00002CB8 58                      	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 30121                                  
 30122 00002CB9 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 30123 00002CBB 2EF726[282C]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 30124 00002CC0 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 30125 00002CC2 01DA                    	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 30126 00002CC4 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 30127 00002CC6 C3                      	retn
 30128                                  m32E:	
 30129 00002CC7 58                      	pop	ax
 30130 00002CC8 C3                      	retn
 30131                                  
 30132                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30133                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 30134                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30135                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 30136                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 30137                                  ; ERROR:   None
 30138                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 30139                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30140                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 30141                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 30142                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30143                                  
 30144                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30145                                  toPara:
 30146 00002CC9 51                      	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 30147                                  
 30148 00002CCA B104                    	mov	cl,4		;
 30149 00002CCC D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 30150 00002CCE 92                      	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 30151 00002CCF B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 30152 00002CD1 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 30153 00002CD3 09D0                    	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 30154                                  
 30155 00002CD5 59                      	pop	cx
 30156 00002CD6 C3                      	retn
 30157                                  
 30158                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30159                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 30160                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30161                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 30162                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 30163                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 30164                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 30165                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30166                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 30167                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 30168                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 30169                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 30170                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30171                                  
 30172                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30173                                  UmbHead:
 30174                                  	; 13/05/2019 (because of callers, pushs & pops are not needed here)
 30175                                  
 30176                                  	;push	si ; ?
 30177                                  	;push	ds ; ? 
 30178                                  	;push	es
 30179                                  	;push	bx ; *	
 30180                                  
 30181                                  	; 09/04/2019
 30182                                  	; !!! No need to save es,bx,ds,si above !!! (es,bx are changed here)
 30183                                  
 30184 00002CD7 B452                    	mov	ah,GET_IN_VARS		; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 30185 00002CD9 CD21                    	int	21h
 30186                                  
 30187 00002CDB 26A18C00                	mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 30188                                  	
 30189                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30190 00002CDF 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 30191 00002CE2 F5                      	cmc
 30192                                  	; if AX=0FFFFh -> CF=1
 30193 00002CE3 C3                      	retn
 30194                                  
 30195                                  ; 01/01/2023
 30196                                  ;%if 0
 30197                                  ;	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 30198                                  ;	je	short uhE		; If it's 0xFFFF, it's an error...
 30199                                  ;
 30200                                  ;	clc				; Else, it isn't (CLC done by prev cmp)
 30201                                  ;	;jmp	short uhX
 30202                                  ;	; 12/12/2022
 30203                                  ;	retn
 30204                                  ;uhE:	
 30205                                  ;	stc
 30206                                  ;uhX:	
 30207                                  ;	;pop	bx ; *
 30208                                  ;	;pop	es
 30209                                  ;	;pop	ds ; ?
 30210                                  ;	;pop	si ; ?
 30211                                  ;	retn
 30212                                  ;%endif
 30213                                  
 30214                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30215                                  ;*** isSysMCB - sets ZF if ES points to an MCB owned by "SC" + (8 or 9)
 30216                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30217                                  ; ENTRY:  ES:0 should point to a valid MCB
 30218                                  ; EXIT:   ZF set if owned by SC+8 or SC+9 (for japan)
 30219                                  ; USES:   Flags
 30220                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30221                                  
 30222                                  isSysMCB:
 30223                                  	;push	ax
 30224                                  
 30225                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; Check the owner...

 30231                                  	;jne	short ismX
 30232 00002CE4 26833E010008            	cmp	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],SystemPSPOwner ; 8  ; 09/04/2019
 30233 00002CEA 7507                    	jne	short ismX 
 30234                                  ism10:	
 30235                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.NAME]	; Check the name...
 30236                                  	;cmp	ax,'SC' ; 4353h
 30237 00002CEC 26813E08005343          	cmp	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC'

 30241                                  
 30242                                  ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30243                                  
 30244                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30245                                  ;*** AddrToUmb - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB number
 30246                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30247                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a segment address
 30248                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain the UMB number which contains the address (0==conv)
 30249                                  ; ERROR:  If the address is above UM Range, AX will return as FFFF.
 30250                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 30251                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30252                                  ; An address in the following areas is treated as:
 30253                                  ;    0      <-> umbhead (0x9FFF)          = Conventional memory
 30254                                  ;    0x9FFF <-> addr of first UM sys MCB  = UMB #1
 30255                                  ;      ...
 30256                                  ;    addr of last UM sys MCB <-> TOM      = invalid; returns #0xFFFF
 30257                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30258                                  
 30259                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30260                                  AddrToUmb:
 30261                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30262                                  	;push	cx
 30263                                  	;push	dx
 30264 00002CF4 06                      	push	es
 30265                                  
 30266 00002CF5 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX = address to search for
 30267                                  
 30268 00002CF7 E8DDFF                  	call	UmbHead		; AX = first segment
 30269 00002CFA 722F                    	jc	short atuE	; If it couldn't get it, error out.
 30270                                  
 30271 00002CFC 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; ES = first UMB segment
 30272 00002CFE 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx		; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now... (cx = UMB#)
 30273                                  
 30274                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 30275                                  ; ATU10--ES - Current MCB address
 30276                                  ;        DX - Address given for conversion
 30277                                  ;        CX - Current UMB #
 30278                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 30279                                  
 30280 00002D00 8CC0                    atu10:	mov	ax,es
 30281 00002D02 39D0                            cmp	ax,dx		; Present segment >= given segment?
 30282 00002D04 7328                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep--done.
 30283                                  
 30284 00002D06 E8DBFF                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if this is a system MCB
 30285 00002D09 7501                    	jnz	short atu20
 30286                                  
 30287 00002D0B 41                      	inc	cx		; If it _was_ a system MCB, we're in a new UMB.
 30288                                  atu20:	
 30289 00002D0C 26A00000                	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 30290 00002D10 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end  ; 'Z'
 30291 00002D12 740C                    	je	short atu30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 30292                                  
 30293                                  	;NextMCB es, ax
 30294                                  
 30295 00002D14 8CC0                    	mov     ax,es
 30296                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 30297 00002D16 2603060300              	add     ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30298 00002D1B 40                      	inc     ax
 30299 00002D1C 8EC0                    	mov     es,ax
 30300                                  	
 30301 00002D1E EBE0                    	jmp	short atu10
 30302                                  
 30303                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30304                                  ; if we get to atu30, they specified a number that was past the last MCB.
 30305                                  ; make sure it's not _inside_ that MCB before we return an error condition.
 30306                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30307                                  
 30308                                  atu30:	
 30309 00002D20 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 30310 00002D22 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30311 00002D27 39D0                    	cmp	ax,dx		; Present >= given?
 30312 00002D29 7303                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep! It _was_ inside.
 30313                                  atuE:	
 30314 00002D2B 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx		; Else, fall through with UMB # == -1
 30315 00002D2D 49                      	dec	cx		; (that makes it return 0xFFFF and sets CF)
 30316                                  atuX:	
 30317 00002D2E 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx		; Return the UMB number in AX
 30318                                  	
 30319 00002D30 07                      	pop	es	
 30320                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30321                                  	;pop	dx
 30322                                  	;pop	cx
 30323 00002D31 C3                      	retn
 30324                                  
 30325                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30326                                  ;*** convUMB - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 30327                                  ;            -- if GetXNum read a hex number, we interperete that as a segment
 30328                                  ; address rather than a UMB number... and use that address to look up a UMB.
 30329                                  ; This routine checks for that condition and calls AddrToUmb if necessary.
 30330                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30331                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a UMB number or segment, gnradix has been set by GetXNum
 30332                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain a UMB number
 30333                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30334                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 30335                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30336                                  
 30337                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30338                                  convUMB:
 30339 00002D32 2E833E[282C]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 30340 00002D38 7507                    	jne	short cu10	; If it didn't read in hex, it's not an address
 30341 00002D3A E8B7FF                  	call	AddrToUmb	; Else, convert the address to a UMB number
 30342                                  	;cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 30343                                  	;jne	short cu10
 30344                                  	;inc	ax		; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 30345                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30346 00002D3D 40                      	inc	ax
 30347 00002D3E 7401                    	jz	short cu10	; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 30348 00002D40 48                      	dec	ax
 30349                                  cu10:	
 30350 00002D41 C3                      	retn
 30351                                  
 30352                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30353                                  ;%if 0
 30354                                  ;
 30355                                  ;; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30356                                  ;;*** setUMBs - links umbs and sets allocation strategy for a load
 30357                                  ;;            -- if LoadHigh, the allocation strategy MAY be LOW_FIRST instead
 30358                                  ;; of the usual HIGH_FIRST. See the code.

 30376                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30377                                  ;*** loadLow - returns AL==0 if UMB0 == 0, else AL==1
 30378                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30379                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 30380                                  ; EXIT:   AL==0 if mem strategy should be set to LOW_FIRST, else AL==1
 30381                                  ;         Carry set if UMB0 not specified (_NOT_ an error)
 30382                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30383                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 30384                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30385                                  ; We want to set the memory strategy to LOW_FIRST if the user specified a
 30386                                  ; load UMB, and it is 0.  That 0 can be either from the user having _specified_
 30387                                  ; zero (/L:0;...), or from having specified a too-big min size (/L:1,99999999)
 30388                                  ; such that the load UMB is too small, and shouldn't be used.
 30389                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30390                                  
 30391                                  loadLow:
 30392                                  	;push	ds
 30393                                  	;push	cs		; Point DS into appropriate data segment
 30394                                  	;pop	ds

 30397 00002D42 2EA0[B91F]              	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad]
 30398 00002D46 3CFF                    	cmp	al,UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh, -1
 30399 00002D48 7504                    	jne	short ll10
 30400                                  
 30401 00002D4A F9                      	stc
 30402                                  ll15:
 30403 00002D4B B001                    	mov	al,1		; Return with AL==1 && STC if no UMBs specified
 30404                                  	;stc
 30405                                  	;jmp	short llX
 30406 00002D4D C3                      	retn
 30407                                  ll10:	
 30408 00002D4E 08C0                    	or	al,al		; AL=the load UMB: Is it == 0?
 30409                                  	;jz	short llX	; Yep... CF==0 (from OR) && AL=0, so just exit
 30410                                  
 30411 00002D50 75F9                    	jnz	short ll15	; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30412 00002D52 C3                      	retn
 30413                                  
 30414                                  	;mov	al,1
 30415                                  	;clc
 30416                                  ;llX:
 30417                                  	;pop	ds		; Return DS to where it was
 30418                                  	;retn
